When the group stumbles upon the village of the Coleco tribe, they find themselves at the whim of a crazy witch doctor and his half- baked ideas, which may lead the entire tribe to a grizzly and badly planned demise. When the Witch Doctor decides to sacrifice the Lady Ipeneth to Gyanki’don, the party must chase the giant arachno-ape and his new hostage to the pyramid of Li’kani. Can the party survive the horrors of the Pyramid and recue the beautiful damsel? Will the video game references contained within overpower the rest of the adventure? Will the witch Doctor succeed in accidently killing off his entire tribe? Discover the answers and the punchlines as you and your party search through jungles and temples for "The Last Ditani Princess."

User note: from Episode 18 - Going Bananas

163190.name: DieselStörmers
163190.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in Beta and has not been fully released yet.




User Summary

A mysterious substance known as “Goop” was once thought to be an edible miracle fuel but has since begun transforming the people who ingest it into horrific Orks. As a new recruit of the DieselStörmers the player must move to liberate the city of Ravensdale in a series of randomized missions.

163191.name: We All Hate Your F#*cking Friend
163191.description:
From the Kickstarter description:

We All Hate Your F#*cking Friend is a fast paced and irreverent card game, that really brings out the very best in worst behavior.

Let's say that you meet with a regular game group, and that group has lost a player. You need to fill the empty seat. All the regulars bring an imaginary friend with them, and your only job is to keep your friend from making a fool of him or herself, alienating the host's spouse, and other various acts that would get them sent packing.

We All Hate Your F#*cking Friend is a deck game with positive and negative cards all about what your "friend" does during the game. Play your cards smart and make your "friend" look good, or play against other players' "friends" to make them look like a tool.

Just keep your friend in his seat! The person with the most tolerable friend wins the game.

163192.name: Monster Mix-Up
163192.description:
Mix it up or match it up and be the first to build a monster and race to the finish.

Object of the game is to be the first player to return home after building a complete monster (all four monster parts from the same or different monsters).

The youngest player starts the game by rolling the die and moving that number of spaces. Player can move in any direction around the board or use the arrows to guide them. If a player lands on a monster space, she draws a monster card from the draw pile and places it face up in front of her. If a player lands on a Mix-Up space, she can trade one card with another player. If a player land on Home space, she can return to the Monster Mix-up home space in the center of the board. If a player land on a Put 1 Back space, she must return one of her monster cards to the middle of the draw pile. Players continue to move around the board, collecting monster cards to build their monsters. Once a player has a complete monster, she races back to the Monster Mix-Up home space.

163193.name: Against the Dark Yogi: Campaign Options
rpg: Against the Dark Yogi: Mythic India Roleplaying
163193.description:
From publisher blurb:


Fine-tune your campaign for mythic adventure!

The world of Bhurloka is overflowing with the potential for epic deeds. All that needs to be done is for game masters and players to come together and tell these stories. Against the Dark Yogi: Campaign Options is here to help facilitate this, with new options, new systems and new complete campaign arcs, inspired by Indian myth!

Against the Dark Yogi: Campaign Options is a key supplement for Against the Dark Yogi. It's features include:

Allow players to choose from a variety of non-human races, such as the monkey-like vanara, the snake-like naga, yakshis, suparnas and more.
Emphasize the importance of reincarnation with a optional reincarnation life-path system.
Attach consequences to zones for more dynamic battles.
Send characters into battle with new astras, the god-weapons.
Swear great oaths that the universe itself will enforce.
Create characters without caste.
Play the game with dice instead of cards.
Multiple fleshed out campaign arcs, and more!

163194.name: Phrenic Hegemony
163194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let loose the beasts of the phrenic scourge with this latest release in the Psionic Bestiary! With five new psionic monsters all based on the phrenic scourge, your players will learn just how dangerous the tentacled menace truly is.

Included in Psionic Bestiary: Phrenic Hegemony are the phrenic adept, phrenic dreadnaught, phrenic infiltrator, phrenic larva swarm, and phrenic matriarch, plus variants of the phrenic adept to give some alternate options to keep your players guessing!

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

163195.name: Dredge & Mind-Numb Swarm
163195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Psionic creatures come in all shapes and sizes, as shown by this latest release in the Psionic Bestiary product line. The dredge and mind-numb swarm offer a psionic ooze and psionic swarm.

Unlike most oozes, the dredge has a level of sentience from its psionic nature, leaping at targets from far away and dissolving with its touch, while the mind-numb swarm is the physical embodiment of random thoughts, deafening nearby creatures with thousands of thoughts all turned into a cacophony of noises.

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

163196.name: Deranged Trepanner
163196.description:
From publisher blurb:

Medical procedures aren't always for the best, as shown as shown by this latest release in the Psionic Bestiary product line. The deranged trepanner offers a psionic construct intent on brain surgery.

Perhaps once used to perform life-saving procedures, deranged trepanners now seek to drill into the skulls of any intelligent creature it finds, seeking to relieve suffering, even to the point of death.

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

163197.name: Six Monsters
163197.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Psionic Bestiary contains all manner of new creatures to unleash upon unsuspecting adventurers. In this release, we find six new monsters. Three of them, the brain worm, corpse beetle, and skull thrasher, are intertwined, while the other three, the azrathid, ghaar, and mathara tree, are separate, but interesting adversaries. These creatures range in CR, but all are ready for use in games that include psionic support!

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

163198.name: Part 9
163198.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Psionic Bestiary contains all manner of new creatures to unleash upon unsuspecting adventurers. In this release, we find six new monsters. Presented in this release are six new psionic monsters. From the subterranean and tentacled brataurus, to the aquatic dulah, to the one-eyed reva, these creatures provide interesting adversaries for different environments. These creatures range in CR, but all are ready for use in games that include psionic support!

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

163199.name: Part 10
163199.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nine new psionic monsters await within the pages of this part of the Psionic Bestiary!

From inconspicuous creatures like the mechanical phrenic conduits and the iniro plant creatures, to the sinister Marked Ones, to the downright vicious mindrippers and zurami, this release has a variety of new psionic creatures for use in your games.

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

163200.name: Dragons
163200.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dragons are perhaps one of the most iconic monsters to be found in any bestiary, so the Psionic Bestiary would not be complete without its own set of psionic dragons!

Included in this release of the Psionic Bestiary are six different dragons. Five are themed after different aspects of psionics, such as the cypher who deals with clairsentience and the cryptic class, while the imagos is based on metacreativity and the aegis class. The six, the ksarite dragon, is a more bestial creature with limited intellect but formidable abilities.

Each dragon is presented with Young, Adult, and Ancient stat blocks, as well as rules for progressing to any of the different dragon age categories.

163201.name: The Djinn of the Deep
163201.description:
The newest adventure, hot off the electronic press from Silver Gryphon Games, the Djinn of the Deep has been released! Get into this pulp adventure set in 1923, see what's in store for your pirate PCs in the Arabian Sea, and survive! Inspired by Discovery Channel's Shark Week (we're not affiliated with them, they're not affiliated with us, but we do love Shark Week!), this adventure is Savage Worlds specific, with not one, but two maps, amazing illustrations by up-and-coming artist, Alberto Tavira, as well as several other illustrators!

Be sure to read the special note from the author on the copyright page so you can see why this adventure is such an amazing feat to have accomplished for us, and why it's going to be so much fun to run at your game table! Set up as a one-shot that is perfect for convention or game day play, or even for a single-shot game with your normal gaming group, this adventure can be just the beginning for your characters as they travel though a world still haunted by superstition, ancient gods, and divine retribution...and really, REALLY big sharks.

(from the publisher)

163202.name: Twilight Crusade
163202.description:
From the Introduction:

Twilight Crusade is an adventure in three parts that focuses on the actions of Vir Modren and the politicking between his vassals. It takes the Explorers on a Grand Endeavour into the heart of Modren's Realm, alongside the acolytes of an ardent Inquisitor and his unexpected allies - a hunter cadre of Tau - from the far-flung reaches of the galaxy. The Explorers must venture deep into Modren's domain and negotiate the power-struggles of his many followers in order to gain entry to his personal fortress, where they can confront him directly.

The three chapters of this adventure form a Grand Endeavour that provides the GM with a framework to gauge the progress and success of the Explorers as they venture into Modren's Realm and navigate the intrigues of Modren's vassals. This Endeavour can be modified to suit the GM's needs and broken down into smaller sections or padded out with new goals depending on the actions of the Explorers. A detailed breakdown of the Grand Endeavour's objectives can be found at the end of each chapter of the adventure.

In addition, this adventure gives GMs the perfect opportunity to incorporate the content of the Tau Character Guide, as the warriors of that xenos race are featured extensively throughout.

163203.name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil
videogamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
163203.description:
from:
http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/138233/ascension-rise-vig...

Ascension: Rise of Vigil is a deck-building game in which players acquire cards from a central pool, then place those cards in their discard pile to be shuffled into their deck for later use; creatures also show up in that shared card pool, and players can combat them to earn victory points (VPs) and possibly other benefits, such as the ability to remove less useful cards from their deck or to banish cards from the pool that others might find useful. The game ends once all the available VPs have been claimed or the shared deck of cards runs out.

Ascension: Rise of Vigil, part of the Ascension deck-building game series, is both a standalone game for 2-4 players and an expansion that can be combined with any other Ascension game to support up to six players.

Rise of Vigil introduces treasure cards to the game system, with all treasure cards in this set being "Energy Shard". When a treasure card is drawn from the shared deck, you place it in the empty space in the shared pool, then continue to draw until you reveal a hero, monster or construct to cover the treasure. When you acquire or defeat that top card, you also gain the treasure, which is added to your deck like hero and construct cards. When you play a treasure from your hand, you immediately draw another card from your deck; more importantly, you can use the energy on these cards to activate special powers on certain heroes, constructs and monsters. (Non-treasure cards can also provide energy, but they are usually worth VPs whereas treasure is worthless aside from the energy.) Energy available on a turn can be "spent" more than once, so if you have, say, two energy, then you can power up all cards with an Energize cost of two or less.

163204.name: Factorio
163204.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Factorio is a game in which you build and maintain factories.

You will be mining resources, researching technologies, building infrastructure, automating production and fighting enemies. Use your imagination to design your factory, combine simple elements into ingenious structures, apply management skills to keep it working and finally protect it from the creatures who don't really like you.

Source: The Developer Website.

163207.name: Sokobond
videogamehonor: 2014 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
163207.description:
User Summary

An elegant puzzle game similar to sliding Sokoban puzzles. In this case you slide atoms around to connect them, split them, turn them, bond them in order to create a predetermined, but unknown molecule.

163208.description:
It takes both a keen eye and a bit of luck to make it in the world of junk. Players scrape and collect the best junk on their way to becoming the most profitable junkyard!

The game is played in rounds. Each round represents a month of time in which the players collect the most valuable cards they can from the deck or the discard pile, trying to avoid accidentally trashing their valuables in the process. As each round ends, the total value of the collected cards are added to each player's score.

The first player to reach $10,000 is declared the Junkyard King!
163208.name: Junkyard King

163209.name: Standard Action: The Card Game
163209.description: In Standard Action: the Card Game, players build a 4-member adventuring party and set out to earn a reputation as the greatest adventurers in the world. Each round, players gather party members and important items in Town, and then head out Adventuring to earn Reputation Points. The first player to 10 points is the winner.

163210.name: Who's Your Heavenly Father?
163210.description:
Players aim to deduce who the One True God is, and to become virtuous in His eyes, before Judgment Day.

Each of the 10 possible gods prefers a different combination of the four virtues: Benevolence, Justice, Selfishness, and Xenophobia. Players accumulate virtue tokens by responding to cards with moral dilemmas, hypothetical situations in which they must choose between exhibiting one virtue or another. They may also use Prophet and Skeptic cards to look at the false gods, deducing the identity of the One True God by process of elimination.

Eventually someone will call for Judgment Day, when the One True God is revealed and players receive positive or negative points depending on which virtues that god liked or did not like.

163211.description:
From Cool Mini or Not:

Our folding dice tower is perfect for making sure your rolls are nicely randomised and don't go flying off the table or knocking over figures. Because of its clever folding design and hard plastic construction, it can be easily carried around. The dice tower comes with 5 stickers of all Zombicide boxes for you to customise your tower! The folded tower measures 10cm x 12,5cm x 4,5cm.
163211.name: Zombicide: Folding Dice Tower

163213.name: Monopoly: Pasadena Centennial 1886-1986 (Pasanopoly)
163213.description: This spin off of the classic game Monopoly celebrates the town of Pasadena's centennial.

163214.name: Monopoly: Mexico City Edition
163214.description: This spin off of Monopoly includes popular streets and locations within the Mexico City region. The game board, cards, and instructions are printed Spanish.

163215.name: PLONK - Vihan Lasten noppasysteemi, versio 0.1
163215.description:
User description:
PLONK is a new rules system for Vihan Lapset RPG. Due to criticism toward diceless FLOW-system originally used in Vihan Lapset, the developers decided to publish an alternative rules system using six sided dice.

The PLONK-system is still under development and this version 0.1 is the first published version. It is given out for free from the publisher's booth at conventions for players who have bought Vihan Lapset. The system is meant for Vihan Lapset RPG, but the rules themselves are not tied to the game, so it could be used as an universal system for any RPG.

163216.name: Przepustka
163216.description:
Po licznych bojach i heroicznych wysiłkach, dla każdego legionisty przychodziła upragniona chwila wytchnienia. Zasłużony urlop – PRZEPUSTKA – w czasie której, można było odwiedzić rodzinny dom czy też stęsknioną narzeczoną. Łatwiej powiedzieć, trudniej wykonać. Trwała wojna, wszędzie zniszczenia, pociągi przepełnione, po drogach grasują Kozacy a na wszystkich maszerujących z frontu, podejrzliwe spoglądali austriaccy żandarmi. Nasza Przepustka obowiązywała jednak tylko 7 dni - 7 krótkich dni i nocy. Legioniści musieli więc się spieszyć i liczyć na łut szczęścia.

Przepustka to gra przeznaczona dla 2,3,4 bądź 5 graczy. Otrzymują oni pod kontrole dwóch legionistów. Gracze muszą starać się tak poprzez zagrywanie kart ruchu sterować swoimi legionistami by ci dotarli do swoich rodzinnych domów narzeczonych i nie wpadli w tarapaty. Gracze za osiągnięte cele otrzymują punkty zwycięstwa. Te można również zyskać dzięki kartom lub odwiedzeniu miejsc pamięci. Wygrywa ten gracz którego legioniście zdążą uzbierać najwięcej punktów zwycięstwa


After numerous battles and heroic efforts, a much-desired rest aould arrive for every soldier. Well-deserved leave - Furlough - during which it was possible to visit home or a fiancée. Easy to say, hard to accomplish. The war continues, and there are disuptions everywhere and overcrowded trains. Cossacks are prowling along the roads and suspicious Austrian military policemen are looking on marching from the front soldiers. Our Furlough is in force only for the week - 7 short days and nights. The soldiers must act quickly and count on a bit of luck.

Przepustka (A Furlough) is a game intended for 2, 3, 4 or 5 players. Each of players controls two soldiers - using movement cards they help them reach family and friends safely and don't get into trouble. Victory points are awarded for visited destinations. It is also possible to gain these points thanks to cards or by visiting storage locations. The winner is the player whose soldiers manage to gather most victory points.

163217.name: Faewood Loft Expansion
163217.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Elves of Faewood found no peace living in the shadows of the ancient trees, so they built their town high above the troubles of the world below. Faewood Loft is a treetop village, perched high above the misty forest of Faewood. Homes are made in hollowed trees or on wooden platforms, strung together with a network of ropebridges and walkways. At night the fruit of the trees give out a pale blue glow, illuminating the walkways and platfirms of Faewood Loft.

Faewood Loft Expansion is the perfect location for numerous adventures - a town of wood elves, forest dwelling goblins - even an Ewok village if you're playing Star Wars! Provided with both day and night versions, this geomorphic set is very versatile.

Faewood Loft Expansion is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Faewood Loft Expansion is a geomorphic set, comprising 12 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. (Day and night versions of 6 different tiles). Each tile features a treetop village, with hollowed trees, walkways and ropebridges.

Faewood Loft Expansion expands the village with the following locations:

The Meeting Tree - parliament, arena, law court
The Tavern/Shop - a place to buy goods, or have a drink
The Sacred Tree - A temple, home of a holy tree
The Lift - the link between Faewood and the ground
The FourWays - a ropebridge linking area
Empty Space - no walkways or buildings - just empty space above the forest
Included: Single & double doors new for Faewood Loft, and extra rope bridges.




Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and non-gridded versions. (n.b. gridless version only available as full jpeg).

163218.name: The Skyscrape
163218.description:
From publisher blurb:

IT DARKENS THE SKY

A disk the size of a modern metropolis hovers over the Ninth World, darkening the sky and the lives of those below it. What secrets lie within this mysterious artifact of the prior worlds? What power keeps it above the world, a flying shin in the night? Questions like these plague those who have seen this remnant of the old civilizations of Earth. Some are even inspired to invent or find some way to join the socalled Skyscrape up in the heavens and bring its treasures back down.

EXPLORATIONS: THE SKYSCRAPE is a six part adventure series for Numenera, detailing a flying metropolis full of prior world wonders. It is the second in our Explorations series: a set of adventure supplements leveraging Numenera’s unique Discovery system for experience to create excitingly exploration-based game sessions.

It provides the following:

A six part adventure, exploring the city, its trap-filled underground, and the "shimmering spire" that forms the pinnacle of the ancient metropolis' majesty.
Three new Descriptors for scavengers: Erudite, Impervious, and Voracious.
Three new Foci for heroes who aim to learn the secrets of the ancients: Deciphers Signs and Symbols, Removes Barriers, and Repairs Ancient Devices.
New loot customized for adventures in the Skyscrape: 100 new Oddities, 5 Artifacts, and 36 Cyphers (in an easy print-and-cut format).

163219.name: The Cipher
163219.description:
From publisher blurb:

The cipher has an empathic or psychic connection to a single animal. He or she can talk to the animal or sense its emotions; see through its eyes or know what is around.

Or maybe make things worse.

The Carcass is a roleplaying story game where players take on the roles of the last members of a dying post-apocalyptic tribe. The tribal leader is dead, the community in tatters, and the future a mystery. What will become of you in this barren wasteland?

163220.name: Death to Alignment!
163220.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alignment System, I pronounce you guilty of being unfun!

Death to Alignment! is a new 3rd Party Product for the Pathfinder Role-Playing Game. Designed for those gamers dissatisfied with the current morality sytem and its flaws, Death to Alignment not only has the tools every Game Master needs to remove it from their games, but a selection of cool and intriguing new options! Included within this book are:

Alterations to existing classes, spells, magic items, and other alignment-focused rules
Variant morality systems, such as a 3-axis alignment of Good/Neutral/Evil
A new paladin archetype, feats, domains, and morality-free versions of popular spells!




If you always wanted to ditch the burdensome headaches alignment causes in your gaming group, then look no further! Death to Alignment! is here to answer your prayers!

163221.name: The Sunken Relluk
rpgseries: Remarkable Races: Pathway to Adventure Edition
163221.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remarkable Races is going beneath the waves in a new series called "Remarkable Races Submerged." These new racial supplements will add an aquatic flair to our beloved Remarkable Races line, transforming many of your favorite races for use with the Cerulean Seas Campaign Setting, as well as introducing a few new ones.

We will start the line with the Sunken Relluk. Ever wanted to play a man-sized wooden tiki mask, propelled by water jets, and bejeweled with glowing gemstones? Now is your chance!

This book expands on the material presented in the Cerulean Seas Campaign Setting, bringing you a new PC race for aquatic adventure!

163222.name: Darkwood Arc Excursion: Barrow of the Cursespawn
163222.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Barrow of the Cursespawn" is a 32-page module-type adventure for 4 PCs level 7. This product is compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Set in the kettle lands, just south of the booming prospect town of Darkwood, players must face the dangers of an abandoned barrow once used as the spiritual center of a local tribe. Sharp wit, blades, and magic are all necessary to topple the forces behind a powerful and ancient curse.

This adventure can be played as a stand-alone module but also presents ways to connect your campaign to the Darkwood Adventure Arc. Along the way, opportunities are presented to side with important townsfolk or betray them using the Coalition system presented in the Darkwood Adventure Arc.

Highlights:

Can be played as a stand-alone product or connect to the Darkwood Adventure Arc
Designed for 4 PCs at level 7.
32 full-color Pages of Content!
1 Regional Map of the Kettle Lands
1 New Creature Subtype
3 New Monsters
1 New Language
1 New Affliction
3 Puzzles for players to solve within the barrow
Expanded Background Story for one of four iconics presented in the Darkwood Adventure Arc
Compatible with A New (Optional) Dynamic Role-Playing Element that brings consequences based on decisions the PCs make.

163223.name: Capers & Cons: The Heist Movie Q•RPG Game
163223.description:
From publisher blurb:

Capers & Cons is the Q•RPG game for sessions based on heist movies like Ocean's Eleven. Because of that, the GM page is rather different to our other Q•RPG games, and offers advice tailored to running games in this particular genre. If you want to set up an elaborate criminal conspiracy to get your hands on the bad man's cash, then this is the game for you!

163224.name: Cloaks & Cutlasses: The Q•RPG Game of Swashbuckling Adventure
163224.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cloaks & Cutlasses is the Q•RPG game for sessions based on the classic era of swashbuckling - the one where pirates, musketeers, Jacobites and smugglers abound. If you've been drawn here by the likes of The Three Musketeers, Kidnapped, Pirates of the Caribbean or the movies of Errol Flynn, then this is the game for you!

163225.name: Gaslamps & Gaiters: The Q•RPG Game of Victorian Fantasy
163225.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gaslamps & Gaiters is the Q•RPG game for gaslamp fantasy and gothic literature game sessions. If you've been inspired to kick some some magically Victorian ass by the likes of Dracula, She, Infernal Devices, King of the Khyber Rifles, Van Helsing, The Laws of Magic or The Parasol Protectorate, then this is the game for you!

163226.name: Handguns & Holograms: The Dystopian Cyberpunk Q•RPG Game
163226.description:
From publisher blurb:

Handguns & Holograms is the Q•RPG game for dystopian, tech-noir, cyberpunk or near-future games. If you want an evening spent gunning for the bad guys in the tradition of Ghost In The Shell, Judge Dredd, Blade Runner, or The Bourne Legacy, then this is the game for you.

163227.name: Race to Riches
163227.description:
For party and holiday!

Combined bid, luck, contest in a game.

The rules are simple, the process of stimulation, and yet joyous explosion point game depth, especially for playing together in the New Year with their families!

This is not only a game, but also is table decorations!

Do follow 7 steps in a round:
Step 1: Auction to become the banker.
Step 2: The banker pay into Money Pool, choose a Race Card and receive 6 Point Cards.
Step 3: All player except banker place a Large/Small Betting Card.
Step 4: All player except banker guess the banker's Point Cards.
Step 5: Show Point Cards and distribute the Money Pool to those players who made the correct bet.
Step 6: The banker moves statues of deities forward.
Step 7: End the current round.

Race Card is worth $80 for the first place, 60 for the second place, 30 for the third place, 0 for the fourth place. Each player sum the values of Game Coins and Race Cards in his/her possession. The player with the largest sum wins the game.

163228.name: Hell & Honour: The Military Sci-Fi Q•RPG Game
163228.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell & Honour is the Q•RPG game for military sci-fi games. If you want to forge a reputation as a warrior among the stars in an evening of fun with friends, this is the game for you.

163229.name: Hotdogs & Hexes: The Urban Fantasy Q•RPG Game
163229.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hotdogs & Hexes is the urban fantasy Q•RPG game. If you want an evening's fun in the vein of Hellblazer, The Dresden Files or Rivers of London, this is the Q•RPG for you.

163230.name: Katanas & Kung Fu: The Martial Arts Movie Q•RPG Game
163230.description:
From publisher blurb:

Katanas & Kung Fu is the Q•RPG game for devising a session based on martial arts movies. If the likes of Jet Li, Jackie Chan or Toshiro Mifune have inspired you to become heroes for an evening, then this is the game for you.

163231.name: Knights & Knaves: The Medieval Q•RPG Game
163231.description:
From publisher blurb:

Knights & Knaves is the Q•RPG game for games set in our own world's medieval period. Fight greedy sheriffs and honorable infidels as you play games inspired by legends like Robin Hood, Richard the Lionheart and El Cid!

163232.name: Longswords & Liches: The Medieval Fantasy Q•RPG Game
163232.description:
From publisher blurb:

Longswords & Liches is the Q•RPG game for traditional swords & sorcery, dungeon-crawling fantasy. Get your kicks here for an evening of world-saving in a medieval world of wizards, orcs and demons.

163233.name: Mobsters & Molls: The Mobster Movie Q•RPG Game
163233.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mobsters & Molls is the Q•RPG game for playing out your own mobster movie at home.Inspired by The Godfather, Gangster Squad, The Wire, Scarface and many more classic works, if you want an escapist evening on the wrong side of the 20th century's law, then this is the game for you!

163234.name: Perps & Procedure: The Q•RPG Game for Police Procedurals
163234.description:
From publisher blurb:

Perps & Procedure is the Q•RPG game for those of you inspired by tv shows like Bones, Castle or Homicide: Life on the Killing Street. If you want to interrogate suspects, chase killers and catch bad guys, then this is the game for you.

163235.name: Prairies & Pistols: The Wild West Q•RPG Game
163235.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prairies & Pistols is the Wild West Q•RPG game. If you've been inspired to play by the likes of Django Unchained, Zane Grey, Unforgiven, Remember Valdez, The Magnificent Seven or The Duke's very existence, then this is the game for you!

163236.name: Rapiers & Rayguns: The Sword & Planet, Atom Punk Q•RPG Game
163236.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rapiers & Rayguns is the Q•RPG game inspired by the sword & planet space opera of the pulp era. Classics like John Carter of Mars, the Lensman cycle, and homages like the Deathstalker Saga are at the heart of this edition. If you want to defeat the maniacal Priest-King, save the beautiful princess, duel with proud natives and do it all with a rakish grin, then this is the game for you.

163237.name: Rockets & Robots: The Sci-Fi Q•RPG Game
163237.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rockets & Robots is the Q•RPG game inspired by the classic science fiction of Star Wars, Star Trek and Babylon 5. If you want to fight evil emperors, proud warrior aliens or emotionless cyborgs in your quest to save the galaxy in an evening, then this is the game for you.

163238.name: Steam & Spectacles: The Steampunk Q•RPG Game
163238.description:
From publisher blurb:

Steam & Spectacles is the Q•RPG game for steampunk game sessions. We all have our own favourite steampunk universes, but if you want to be in the Wild Wild West, ride with the Lancers of Peshawar or star in an Edisonade against the Martian invaders, then this is the game for you!

163239.name: Superspies & Silhouettes: The Spy-Fi Q•RPG Game
163239.description:
From publisher blurb:

Superspies & Silhouettes is the Q•RPG game for sessions based on classic spy stories like the The Man From U.N.C.L.E., James Bond and Bourne series. If you want to catch a villain, blow up the base and save the western world, then this is the game for you!

163240.name: Xeno-archaeology!
rpghonor: 2015 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee
2015 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Silver Winner
163240.description:
From publisher blurb:

“No other ancient city on Mars had been laid out in that manner; and the strange, many-terraced buttresses of the thick walls, like the stairways of forgotten Anakim, were peculiar to the prehistoric race that had built Yoh-Vombis.” From the Face on Mars to Precursor artifacts orbiting dead quasars, the mysteries of space aren’t all astrophysical. For some answers, you have to dig. Ruins — of cities, starships, and planets — hold danger and horror, riches and knowledge. What a lost species or a cunning GM can build, bold exo-archaeologists and their players can uncover.

163241.name: Promised Land
163241.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Promised Land Series Pitch by Caias Ward, players explore a far-future religion based on enlightenment through genetic engineering and organic technology, a squad of young cadets struggles with their commanders, their fellow cadets, the outside universe and crises of faith.

163242.description:
Description from the publisher:

Based on the Eisner Award-winning comic series by John Layman and Rob Guillory, CHEW: Cases of the FDA seats 2-5 players and is playable in about 30 minutes. Players compete to close cases pulled directly from the pages of the ongoing comic book. They'll enlist partners like John Colby, Amelia Mintz, and even Buttercup the lion, while simultaneously sending fiendish villains and cultists out to sabotage their rivals' investigations.
163242.name: CHEW: Cases of the FDA
boardgamepodcastepisode: Chew Board Game Review
Episode 3 - Scare Tactics

163243.name: Clockwork Wars: Sentience
163243.description:
Sentience is an expansion for Clockwork Wars, an epic board game of conquest, discovery, and espionage from Eagle Games. It adds a number of new Discovery and Espionage cards, a new Court, more hexagonal tiles to make even larger and more varied maps, 2 new Territory types (the Observatory and Nexus), and a fifth race: the Inventions. This now allows for 5-player games.

The civil war between the Purebreeds, Mongrels, Troglodtyes, and Rhinochs has raged for what seems like ages. Amidst this endless chaos, the races struggle for any advantage that will turn the tides of war. Recently, some Mongrel scouts happened upon a gaping chasm of magical energy deep beneath the surface of the earth. Technowizards from across the land swiftly converged upon this newly christened “nexus” and set about harnessing its power. Meanwhile, scientists and priests have constructed magnificent observatories to study the heavens, and the mysteries revealed therein have been both startling and profitable.

But by far the most significant turn of events has been the emergence of a new race – the autonomous, thinking machines known as the Inventions. Some suspect the first Invention was created by Sir Erasmus Paniscus, the brilliant Troglodyte engineer. They have rapidly multiplied since their origin, due to their miraculous ability to build new Inventions in their astonishing magical workshops. For reasons unclear, they possess a profound, almost mystical love of the natural world, and have chosen to shape themselves primarily in the forms of insects, spiders, and beetles. They are a young race, exhibiting an innocent naivety of their immense potential and power. But they understand that they must defend themselves in this time of war if they wish to survive as a free, sentient race.

163244.description:
Objective: be the first gaining most winning points after getting rid of all your cards; find correct answers for appropriate questions; learn more about Cologne
- acting by turns -
draw cards (according to number of participants) from a shuffled pile {230 'sag-mal' cards (trivia),90 'mach-mal' cards (action/creativity) and 30 'moment-mal' cards (tactical decisions/gambling)};
active player chooses one of his/her cards, reads the question (mostly a poser, sometimes a stumper) about Cologne trying to find/get the right answer... clockwise. Wrong reply => Must draw an additional card. Correct? Put this card upon your bonus pile (=5 bonus points). No one knows => question master must discard this card upon his/her malus pile.
Game ends after anybody got rid of his/her cards
note:
can also be used as an expansion for Kölle das Stadt-Spiel
163244.name: Kölle Das Spielchen

163245.name: Die große Reise
163245.description:
simple 'roll&Move' game;
be the first reaching space '100'; ending on a an illustrated space follow instructions glued into the lid

163246.name: Interregnum (Issue 3 - May 1994)
rpgissuearticle: The Fastest Tentacle in the West
163246.description:
User Summary:

The theme of this issue is DREAMS.

boardgameimplementation: Twilight Struggle Turn Zero and Promo Packs
boardgamecompilation: Twilight Struggle Turn Zero and Promo Packs
163247.description:
Twilight Struggle: Turn Zero is a new mini-expansion that lets players explore alternate starting situations for the two superpowers. What if Chiang's forces had held on in southern China? What if Churchill's Tories had won re-election in 1945? And what if the Western Allies had crossed the bridge too far, and reached Berlin first? These and other possibilities that alter the opening setup in Twilight Struggle are now open to players. Both seasoned veterans and new arrivals will enjoy the many new plays and dilemmas introduced here for the first time. This expansion includes the following:

One (1) Turn Zero Rules sheet

Taiwan [3] country counter
Turn marker (backside is blue and states - US First)
Defcon 1 Blocked counter
Suez Crisis - No Effect (blue) counter
Socialist Governments - No Effect Turns 1-2 (blue) counter
-2 UK Influence (blue) counter

Six (6) large Crisis cards, with new setup instructions per die roll:
Yalta and Potsdam
Chinese Civil War
1945 UK Election
Israel
VE Day
VJ Day

Ten (10) Statecraft Cards:
Soviet cards: Andropov, Khrushchev, Molotov, Beria, KGB (Dummy Card)
US cards: Kennan, Acheson, Marshall, Dulles, OSS (Dummy card)

Two (2) Modified Event Cards
Europe Scoring (Allied Berlin) - Early War
Nationalist China 2 (US) Early War

Two (2) Card Description sheets (with Optional Space Race Track instructions on reverse)
(Note: The cards described are the cards included in the Promo Deck #1 and Promo Deck #2)
163247.name: Twilight Struggle: Turn Zero

163248.name: Kukulcan
163248.description:
User Summary

It is 1519 and you are an Aztec scribe. Evil omens have instilled fear in the citizens of Tenochtitlan. Your leader, Montezuma II, has called for you to find the fabled Feathered Serpent.

The game is a Text Adventure with graphics. By typing 'H' further historical background on the ancient Aztecs will be displayed.

163249.name: Weird Wars Rome Combat Map: Druid Circle and Village
163249.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a double sided, erasable, poster map for use with Weird Wars Rome or any roleplaying or miniatures game.

163250.name: Weird Wars Rome Combat Map: Fortress and Village
163250.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a double sided, erasable, poster map for use with Weird Wars Rome or any roleplaying or miniatures game.

163251.name: Bocce Piatta
163251.description:
Did your Mother tell you not to play ball in the house?
Well, now you can.
With Bocce Piatta you can play a game of Bocce just about anywhere.
Bocce Piatta is a table top version of the classic ball sport Bocce.

The starting player tosses the Pallino disc onto a flat surface and players take turns tossing their Bocce Ball cards in an attempt to get closest to the Pallino. Points are scored just like the real game of Bocce.

Bocce Piatta comes with 12 cards in 3 pairs of warm colors and 3 pairs of cool colors, so it can be played by 2 players or up to 6 players in teams.

Bocce Piatta can be played on just about any flat surface. On the table, the floor, the lawn or even at the beach.

163252.name: Horse Around
163252.description: A roll and move horse racing/betting game. Each player has anywhere from 1 to 4 horses that race around the board. The board is broken down into 4 "races". Fees are paid to enter each race and bets can be placed on whether the horse wins, shows, or places (determined by die roll/odds). Spaces on the board give player money, cause them to draw cards, cause them to gain additional horses, win/lose bets, etc.

163253.name: Battle of Capua
163253.description:
Part of the Roman Empire and home to many of the infamous Gladiators of the age, Capua became hotly contested in 212 BCE. In this quick card driven game for 2 to 4 players, you take on the role of a General trying to grab control of the city. In order to win, you will need to build a strong army and best your opponents through six battles.

The game is played over three phases. First, you draft cards to build you army and amass gold. Then, you use the gold to purchase battle upgrades via an auction. Finally, you pit your army against the armies of your opponents, trying to gain control of the six different districts of Capua. Each district you control makes your army that much stronger. In the end, the player who controls the most, and the most powerful districts will reign supreme over the city.

163254.name: Drow
163254.description:
From publisher blurb:

The peace between the immortal races that emerged from the Forging of the Dvergr did not last long—find out what originally begat the antagonists of Rise of the Drow in this very book! Bring your Pathfinder game to the next level with our book on the drow—it’s as devious and deadly as its namesake.

In Underworld Races: Drow you’ll find...

new favored class options for PCs of every sort!
cunning new equipment like weapon webbing and web shackles!
Spider Speaker, Survivor’s Instinct, Vindictive, and more new feats!
new magic items like drow soldier tins and underwater!
not just some new spells, but the entire drow domain!

163255.description:
Winner of the wargame category in the 2014 solitaire print and play contest. Released in early 2015 as a physical boardgame by White Dog Games.

The game is a solitaire area-movement wargame, simulating the Reconquest of the Iberian peninsular by the Christian kingdoms from the 8th to 15th centuries.

The player takes the role of the Christian forces. Starting off with a small part of Northern Spain, the player purchases Armies and cities, with the goal of defeating the Moslem forces and reconquering Iberia for Christendom.

Game play involves battles, sieges, random events, and the actions of the Moslem forces, controlled by the game.

Random events include Viking raiders, French intervention, Famine, Rebellions, Religious strife, Christian Military Orders, and more.

Components: 1 map, 100 counters (3 different sizes), rules.
Playing time: 1-2 hours

The White Dog games version contains cleaned-up rules, additional optional rules, including alternative random event tables, and a historical scenario for every one of the 20 turns of the game.
163255.name: Reconquista
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 081 - Reconquista

163256.name: For Gold & Glory
rpg: For Gold & Glory: Old School Roleplaying
163256.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within these pages lie the keys to open worlds of wonder and adventure! Whether you are exploring dank dungeons, forging mighty kingdoms, or questing to save the world, For Gold & Glory contains all that you need to run a complete game. Inside these covers, you will find rules to:

Create heroic characters and guide them as they advance in power.
Equip characters with everything needed to survive the perils of adventure.
Guide characters through encounters, whether through wits and skill or strength of arms.
Reward characters with glittering wealth and wondrous treasures.
Challenge all characters, whether novices or veterans, with over 140 creatures both fair and foul.




For players and game masters alike, For Gold & Glory is compatible with the second edition of the “advanced” version of the world’s most popular role-playing game.

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
163257.description:
Compounded: Geiger Expansion, the first full expansion for the chemistry board game Compounded, gives experienced scientists even more to consider in the lab with the introduction of radioactive elements and compounds. As productivity in the lab increases, so does the chance for radioactivity levels to rise. Scientists have to keep a close eye on the geiger counter or else risk the lab becoming too radioactive in which to work.

The Geiger Expansion introduces a new, interactive paradigm to the base game of Compounded as players now sometimes have to work together to eliminate or reduce the threat of radioactivity. Of course, those players with a propensity for causing chaos have even more methods at their disposal, ensuring that each game is exciting and dynamic.
163257.name: Compounded: Geiger Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 78-- Star Studded Origins 2014 Wrap Up
Episode 81-- Gen Con 2014 Top 11 to Try and Top 11 to Buy with special gues W. Eric Martin from BGG News

163258.name: Trials Fusion - Riders of the Rustlands
163258.description:
User Summary

Trials Fusion - Riders of the Rustlands adds 5 new achievements/trophies, 10 new tracks, 18 new Track Challenges, and new Editor Objects.

163259.name: Duel
163259.description:
You've been walking for days in an endless plain. You vaguely remember a life before this, but now the golden fields are all that remain. In the distance, you spot your first traveler in this strange land, a stranger to you in all ways, save one -­ their sword.
Duel is a 2-­4 player card game, where the object of the game is to be the last man standing. You take turns playing numbered cards with special abilities from your hand to the play tower, and you lose if you can no longer play a card.

163260.name: Call of Cthulhu avventure
163260.description:
user summary

supplement produced by the Italian magazine Anonima Gidierre
this monographic product collects four Call of Cthulhu adventures.

163261.name: The Gaean Reach Gazetteer
163261.description:
Publisher blurb:
An impossibly distant future. A vast sprawl of planets, each without parallel, with its own bizarre customs, bedeviling procedures, and wily inhabitants.
As one of the implacable revenge-seekers populating The Gaean Reach Roleplaying Game, you know that correct intelligence on these worlds makes all the difference between grim success and howling failure.
As a GM running The Gaean Reach Roleplaying Game, this exhaustive cataloging of the planets and places of Jack Vance’s classic science fiction cycle will keep your players hopping.
As a fan of Jack Vance who wouldn’t know a d6 from an intersplit engine, this indispensable guidebook gathers the beauty and danger of his incomparable worlds into one handy reference.

163262.name: The First War
163262.description: An empire-building game for 2 players in which they utilize discovered terrain, four types of pieces and technology cards to their utmost efficiencies. Conflict is entirely deterministic, depending on position and availability of forces, but technology, terrain and reinforcements are determined by varying levels of randomness. In particular, players have some control over which technologies they decide to pursue and some control over the types of reinforcements that appear.

163263.description:
Land, Wealth and Fame.

This is what inspired Vikings to travel far from home. Fighting dangerous seas, foes and each other. They would go anywhere, anytime and in any weather.

The Viking leaders of these expeditions were called Sea Kings because of their skills in traveling uncharted waters to destinations few knew. And they wanted to be King, back in their home lands. To fulfill their ambitions, they raided, traded, and settled far away lands to attract followers in their quest to become King. And some succeeded.

You are one of the Viking leaders seeking fortune in the unknown with your long boat and crew. Do you have what it takes to be a great Sea King by making new discoveries, settling hostile lands, crafty trading, and raiding with the fierceness of a Norseman? If so, seek the throne and make it yours.
163263.name: Sea Kings
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 1: Getting Started with Designing Tabletop Games

163264.name: The Legend of Zelda: Mystical Seed of Courage
163264.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Mystical Seed of Courage was supposed to be released several months after its prequels and would have featured Farore as its oracle, and was originally set to be centered around time travel and puzzles concerning the time of day. It was scrapped due to problems in the debugging process with how all three games interacted with one another.

163265.description:
Overview

Galactic Hegemony is a solitaire "4X" game of galactic domination.

The game is played on a randomly generated hex map galaxy board.

Each turn player gains resources from colonised planets which are then used to move their spacecraft, colonise new planets, build infrastructure and crush rebellion.

Originally an entry in the "2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest"


Files (version 1.2)

Due to BGG file size restrictions you will find the PnP files below


Rules 1.2
Rules 1.2 in booklet form
Full Colour Components 1.2
Low Ink Components 1.2
Deluxe Components 1.2 (Cards/boards have backs, larger planet hexes suitable for A3 GalacticMap)
Deluxe Galactic Map 1.2 suitable for A3 printing
163265.name: Galactic Hegemony

163266.name: Between Chains and Starlight (version 2.0)
163266.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is a revamp of the first version of 'Between Chains and Starlight'. Factions have been overhauled and further elaborated upon, a list of individual star systems has been included, and four individual planets are described in detail, with maps. Creature entries have been adjusted to be more in line with standard rules for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. A brief ruleset for combat in zero-G and alternate gravity environments is included, and various minor changes are made to assorted rules. Most content from 'Dragons in Space (and stuff) has been incorporated into this book, with some alterations, as well as some new additions to the Space Combatants chapter. In addition some of the art has been overhauled, and there are 17 new images, 4 new planetary maps, and assorted minor new art such as emblems.

Magic and technology combine in a science fantasy setting. Against a backdrop of evil empires dominating known space and threatening a primitive world rich in magic, characters fight cyberslavery, animalistic warmachines, and other foes for justice, or merely to survive.

Rules are included for customizable armor, and incorporating magic gear into spacesuits, as well as a list of weapons and their functioning. Characters benefit from expanded use of technology related skills, and can make use of crafting rules for personal gear and all components of ships and vehicles.
For personal combat, over twenty new creatures are introduced, including cyborgs, Living Machines, and spacedwelling undead.
A revamped system for ship and vehicle combat and logistics allows for intuitive and effective ship configuration and operation, with a larger role for electronic warfare. This rules include tables with ship and vehicle classes, customization options, upgrades, equipment and weapons. NPC ships are included, both generic and factionspecific, as well as tables for customizing NPC ship crews. The ship and vehicle section includes optional rules for magic ship equipment.
The book includes four missions taking place in the setting, for characters around level six to ten. The missions come with eighteen color maps and one greyscale map.

163267.name: Brain Quest Numbers Counting Game
163267.description: [From back of the box] Numbers Counting Game is a fun way for kids to get comfortable with numbers. Kids use Picture cards to perform addition and subtraction problems while collecting Picture tokens for their scoring boards. Numbers Counting Game teaches young children number recognition and counting skills.

163268.description:
Town Center: Essen / SPIEL is comprised of four double-sided player boards, with the all-new, limited edition Essen and SPIEL maps. There's also an A5-sized rulesheet/cover that explains the special rules of each map.

Both maps pay homage to the home of all of boardgamedom, that former industrial city by the Rhine, and the world-famous SPIEL fair. Essen is a spread-out urban/sub-urban environment with a distinct value placed on available parking spots, while SPIEL is divided into three large halls with very limited space in which to move around.

Join us in Essen / SPIEL and enjoy Town Center!
163268.name: Town Center: Essen / SPIEL

163269.name: Cyberpunk avventure
163269.description:
User summary

Supplement produced by the Italian magazine Anonima Gidierre:
this monographic product collects three Cyberpunk 2020 adventures.

163270.name: Tra le nebbie del tempo
163270.description:
User summary

Supplement produced by the Italian magazine Anonima Gidierre:
this monographic product collects a seven-parts fantasy adventure for AD&D set in the Forgotten Realms.

163271.name: Master-Quiz
163271.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching the target space
- acting by turns -
The game master rolls the die, draws an appropriate (=matching colour) question asking the player to the left; and if he/she knows the answer the meeple is move forward. There are six different colours matching with six different themes; additionally special cards (1-2-3; yes/no) involve other players, too.

The game can be run with earlier card games out from the Quick-Quiz series, too.

163272.name: The Blue Lion
163272.description:
Paris - The Louvre welcomes an exhibition of famous diamonds from all over the world. Among them, The Blue Lion, also called the Blue Eye, a diamond of unique purity and color is presented to the public. Of course this diamond attracts famous master thieves... but luckily the police will protect it.

You play one of the two thieves (Arsène or Lady X).

You win the game if you are the first player who collects 7 small diamonds either by daring to steal the Blue Lion… or by reporting your opponent to the police.

Adaptation of the board game The Blue Lion

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/104555/blue-lion

163273.name: Diaballik
163273.description:
In this board game inspired by team sports like Hand-Ball, Ultimate, Football, Rugby etc., the players have to bring their ball on the opponent’s start line in order to win the game.

To do so, each player has to be active both in attack and defense.
Based on simple rules, this game actually requires a good strategy and offers quick and dynamic games in which the player can, until the very last minute, reverse the situation and win!

Each in turn, the players can perform 3 actions in whichever order:
They can move their holder twice, one square at a time (it can be the same holder twice or two different holders), and do one pass with the ball. There are a few restrictions: the holder which holds the ball cannot be moved, a holder can only be moved horizontally or vertically, passing the ball is only possible on an horizontal, vertical or diagonal line, whatever the distance, as long as no opposing holder lies between the two holders involved in the pass.
Add to this a last rule as regards unfair game and the whole set of rules is no longer than this paragraph.

This game is within the reach of everyone and children as young as 6 can rapidly enjoy playing. Play with them and you will be amazed at seeing how quickly they learn!

Average game duration: 15 minutes

Adaptation of the board game Diaballik

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/20253/diaballik

163274.description:
Advertising your wines gives you an advantage over your opponents as the advertisers help convince managers to help you in your quest to be the best wine producer because you obviously have the best wines!

The Advertisers, a micro-expansion for Vinhos, adds four new wine expert tiles to the base game. You use the advertiser's effect during your action in order to move a barrel to gain a benefit from a manager, but without having to provide any wine to seal the deal. The power of advertising!
163274.name: Vinhos: The Advertisers

163275.description:
People are one team and try try to escape from the monsters.
The players gain victory points in two ways:
1.Kill the monster together and get the point.
2.Every one have 3 life. The first player to die gets one point, the second player gets two points, and so on.

For example:
A monster with 6 strength. And the team have 7 players.
If more than 5 people stay and fight, they will win the battle and gain points. Someone who leaves the fight will not gain points.

However, if more than one person sneaks out, others will die in the battle and the cowards will gain higher score.

So, in this game. If you think the team can kill the monster, try to ask everyone to stay and fight together. If you think you can't win, just cheat your partner to stay and escape from the battle.
163275.name: Attack on Monster

163276.description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Dortmund each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
note:
game approach is more or less identical with the City Pro Game family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies
163276.name: Gesellschaftsspiel Dortmund

163277.description:
Cardline: Dinosaures is similar to Cardline: Animals — but with dinosaurs! It is a card game played with approximately 100 cards. Both sides of each card depict a dinosaur, its name, its geographic place, while its average length and weight are printed on only one side of the card. For each game, players decide before playing whether they're comparing dinosaur lengths or weights.

At the start of the game, each player places a number of dinosaur cards on the table in front of her with the characteristics hidden. One card is placed in the center of the table with its characteristics revealed. Players then take turns placing a card from their tableau in a row on the table; a player can place a card between any two other cards. After placing the card, the player reveals the characteristics on it. If the card was placed correctly – that is, with the particular characteristic in numerical order compared to all other cards on the table – the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck and adds it to her tableau.

The first player to get rid of all her cards by placing them correctly wins.
163277.name: Cardline: Dinosaurs
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 2: Paris est Ludique 2015

163278.name: Walec Parowy 1914
163278.description:
Walec Parowy 1914 (Steam Roller 1914) is a war board game, which was released in May 2014 by the Forum of Polish Malopolska Branch Historical Society project The Great War in Malopolska - memory and identity.

The game provides two modes - for two or four players. In both cases, each player takes command of two armies or associations operating. It receives the relevant boards of the army and pools chips and card deck of cards generals of staff. If you meet the armies opposing players battle occurs. This is to be decided on the basis of the points of strength and modifiers. The final outcome of the battle can affect tightens card battle. Thanks to the great happiness we can overcome the enemy an advantage of more mesh than allowed by the cube d6. After all, is not familiar with such episodes of military history. The game is won by the player (or the site in the case of 4-seater variant), which scores more points wins. Most gain for controlling individual identified in the scenario, cities. The Russian side can further plunder the fields of the German Empire and the Kingdom of Hungary - action is causing the loss of points by Austria. Extra points goes to sometimes get as a result of the great victories or destruction of the enemy army staff.

163279.name: Kłamcianka Towarzyska
163279.description:
In a world of liars gods, angels and demons, creatures of myth and legend walk among us. Kłamcianka is a card game that simulates the start of these powerful beings in the struggle for considerable rate - angel feathers.

The form of the universe created by James Ćwiek, dozens of unique skills, special cards which place the game on its head and lots of laughter! Make truces, and then it quickly column - in the Liar universe there is nothing permanent.

What is the game? In short, the idea is to collect the largest possible amount of feathers (which icons are shown on almost every card) and most annoy other players would not have a chance with us when it comes to counting points. At the beginning of each game, each participant draws fun for yourself one of the characters and places it face "Inactive" to the top. Then all derive 7 cards on hand and starts playing

A player in his turn, he may do one of the following: attack someone, play the effect described on the card, replace one card to another (in the dark), or select the card to be in the hands of their 7 (if our budget was depleted during the game) . Each card beyond the value of the feathers (which is taken into account only at the end of the game) has a specific strength. The majority also has its effect, which we can use for example during the fight, whether or separately - consuming it his turn.
You have to combine so as to eventually collect as many feathers. For this purpose, it is certainly useful Liars title card, but it also has a hitch - yes, gives the largest amount of feathers (3), however, the player who will be at the end of most "Liars" automatically loses. Remedy this, we can only exchanging with others (hopefully take us to the card), or finding a card Liar, which cancels the harmful effects of one of the Liar

the game can be purchased only in the set of the latest book Ćwiek - "Liar 2.5"
rules have been on the last few pages of "Liar 2.5

163280.name: Tithe
163280.description:
In feudal times, the different taxes levied upon the citizens were essential to maintain the prosperity of the kingdom and to overthrow other lords who taxed to much. Tithe is a fun card game in which four different kings struggle to raise more gold and to take power in the kingdom.

Tithe is a quick and easy game designed by Pablo Bella, for 2-4 players ages 8, lasting about 30 minutes.

In the game, players have hidden identities, and try to gain the power of the crown for their families. There are four kings in the game that make a deck of kings, and determine the predominant color in the course of the game.

In addition to the kings deck, there is a character deck. Players draw cards from this deck, and each round players will play character card to try to win the trick. Each character has a color (of the family), a strength value to measure victories in trick that are played and a value in gold (victory points).

When everybody plays one card strength and families are compared to determine which player wins the trick. This continues until all character cards from the deck have been played. But beware! It is not the player who wins the most tricks that wins the game, but the player that accumulates the most gold!

Tithe is a very quick and simple game, available in Spanish and English version and totally free for all Dizemo fans.

163282.name: Witchology 101
163282.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is time to go back to College. But these colleges aren't like anything you've ever attended. Witchology 101 is a sourcebook for Modern d20 games that adds a little spice and fun to your magically-inclined campaign. Witchology 101 provides you with a secret world within the modern world where witches juggle their magical studies with their daily lives. Includes 30 new feats, 20 new spells and rituals, and new creatures (Brownies, Gremlins, Hobs, Wisps, and Thought Beasts).

This sourcebook is primarily a resource for storytellers, who want to add a more immersive magical element to their game.

163283.name: Tanque
163283.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Try to bleed with dignity."

The Theta Files provide illustrations, game stats, and background for heroes and villains you can drop directly into your 3rd edition Mutants & Masterminds campaign. Tanque is a PL 10 battlesuit with a passion for tech!

163284.name: Prisoners and Escapees
163284.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever created an amazing place for your campaign only to discover that you don't immediately have a collection of NPCs to fill it? Or have your PCs ever stumbled into a place you haven't had time to fully develop as a living, breathing part of the campaign?

Well, why not take out a handful of dice and roll up an instant NPC! Or in this case, an "Insta-NPC"!

The Insta-NPCs product line is designed to offer one or more tables to roll on to figure out a little something about the NPC you're pulling together.

Though the last couple of products have dealt with villains and their minions, this time we deal with a group of individuals who you might encounter just about anywhere. Any society that has a system of laws has law-breakers. And law-breakers must serve time for crimes committed. Those NPCs are the type that your party may meet simply traveling or visiting a crowded marketplace or may even have to go rescue or talk to for information pertaining to a quest or mission.

The story aspects of prisoner NPCs is huge, whether they have escaped, are serving their time peacefully, or have served their time and been released. Any aspect of a particular plot, regardless of system or genre, could be given a new spark with a bit of a past brush with the law.

Obviously not every character your PCs meet in your world are likely to be hardened criminals who have served time for dubious deeds (unless you're roleplaying *IN* a prison, which could be an interesting story technique in and of itself, like with Orange is the New Black or Oz). But depending on what you want to do, a group of escaped prisoners along the lines of O Brother, Where Art Thou? could add some fun color to an otherwise boring road trip!

In this supplement, we break the process into five main steps - who are they, what was the crime, what was the sentence, what's their intent as a prisoner, and what was the cell like.

For example, you might have an Alien who committed a Real crime - Disturbing the Peace - and was sentenced to Weeks in a walled cell and is seeking to simply serve his time so he can leave this godforsaken rock...

"Garm came to the Office of the Mining Controller on Anat III, a small rock that served as offices now that it had been mined out in the Belt. He wanted to voice a grievance about conditions on one of the outer asteroids where he worked - Elinor V. His brother, Barm, had died as a result of poor equipment maintenance due to crappy management. Garm tried talking to the site manager on E-V but was shut down before he ever got in the door. He knew he would lose his job if he went over their heads, but he had to have his voice heard or he could never live with himself. It was a dangerous job but the union was there to keep conditions from getting too bad.

Well, as you might imagine, he couldn't get into the Controller's office to see her. She wasn't taking unannounced visitors at this time. He'd have to go on the waiting list for an appointment and she was backed up far enough that it would be another couple of months at least. So Garm waited until she left her office for the day and tried to talk with her. That didn't go so well either. He ended up in a scuffle with her security people and was put in the local jail to cool off.

He'd be out in another two days and approach it in another way. The news vids were always looking for dirt. He'd give them some..."

Like all Moebius Adventures supplements, Insta-NPCs #5: Prisoners and Escapees is designed to be system- and genre-neutral. This 8 page PDF includes ten (with a bonus) tables with examples, a worksheet, some examples, and four unique NPCs (with portraits) from different genres you can use right away.

163285.name: Shadow Fey
163285.description:
From publisher blurb:


Slip Through the Shadows!

Refined and ruthless, the shadow fey are masters of the Plane of Shadows, and that dark land's code governs their magic, their plots, and their clearly superior view of things. Best never to cross them, for their memories are centuries long.

With powerful shadow magic, a peculiar mastery of time and distance, and obscure codes for dueling and courtship, the shadow fey are maddeningly difficult for others to confront, let alone defeat. But among themselves, they are a friendly crew, and those they consider friends find them strangely loyal and fiercely protective of their sworn companions.

Advanced Races: Shadow Fey gives you everything you need to play a shadow fey adventurer. This 19-page sourcebook by Carlos and Holly Ovalle includes:

the origins and mysteries of the shadow fey, as well as details of their peculiar style, courts, and fashions--insofar as humans can understand such things!
5 new shadow fey racial traits: including Deadly Smile and Shadow Affinity, plus 3 half-elf racial traits including Shadow Fey Blood
11 new feats including Commend, Condescend, Court Noble, Disparage, Fey Birthright, Shadow Walker, and Stealth in Motion
4 class expansions: A new cavalier Order of the Swan, as well as a Shadow Fey bloodline, new rogue advanced talents, and 3 new Shadowsworn shadow talents
2 new archetypes: the Dread Hunter and the Twilight Envoy
The eala arrows, 2 new magic items and 5 spells of the shadow fey
3 new monsters: the eala, the dread horse, and the stryx
And much more!




Hone your dueling blade, prepare a cutting quip, and make your enemies rue they day they met you. You are a dashing scion of the Shadow Courts, and no one stands your equal!

Pick up Advanced Races: Shadow Fey today, and define your own path of ruthless superiority in your next game!

163293.description:

163294.description:
User summary

163295.description:
Objective: become the wealthiest player at the same time anyone is going bankrupt
- moving/acting by turns -

Active player moves forward according spinner result (inner circle); ending on a 'country'-space spinner may be turned again, but outer circle determines, if purchase is:
accepted/not accepted & money lost/for free;
You may add a house or - if you already own this property - proceed it.
Other spaces may force you to win/loose money or to gamble.
Ending on another player's property you must pay according status.

163296.name: Changing Breeds Storyteller's Screen (W20)
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
