Publisher Blurb:

A sturdy three-panel screen featuring a beautiful collage of W20 Changing Breeds art on the outer side, and on the inside there's a selection of charts and other info to make the Storyteller's job a little bit easier

user comment
received as a Kickstarter reward for Changing Breeds (W20)

163297.description:
This is the first of three mini-expansions for Petite Pastiche. Only compatible with the "Petite Pastiche" edition, not with the first edition or international edition of Pastiche.

This expansion pack consists of 3 extra commission cards, with artworks by Franz Marc, Domenico Theotocopuli, and Vincent van Gogh.
163297.name: Petite Pastiche: Extra Commissions #1

163298.description:
This is the second of three mini-expansions for Petite Pastiche. Only compatible with the "Petite Pastiche" edition, not with the first edition or international edition of Pastiche.

This expansion pack consists of 3 extra commission cards, with artworks by George Seurat, Claude Monet, and Mary Cassatt.
163298.name: Petite Pastiche: Extra Commissions #2

163299.name: Firefly Online Cortex
163299.description:
Firefly Online is a strategic online role playing game (RPG) based on Firefly, Joss Whedon’s cult-hit television series. Firefly Online (FFO) is currently in development for Windows-based PCs, Mac OS X, iOS and Android, and may expand to include additional platforms.

In Firefly Online, players assume the role of a ship captain as they hire a crew and seek out adventures, all the while trading with and competing against the millions of other players to try to survive in the Verse: find a crew, find a job, keep flying.

FFO provides a variety of gameplay activities and systems so that players can fully experience life in the Verse.

Assume the role of a ship captain – create a crew and customize a ship
Aim to misbehave in space and planet-side adventures
Cross-platform player experience across devices (pick-up and play from anywhere)
Unique social features connecting Firefly fans
Create a shiny ship and explore the Verse

Source: The Publisher Website.

163300.description: Bejinx cards are a game system that can be paired with any tabletop game. Pull a Bejinx card at the beginning of each turn, and follow its instructions. Some of the fun twists let you get extra turns in the paired game, see another player's hidden items, take another player's game items, or step into another player's shoes. A multigame booster also lets you play multiple interacting games at the same time.
163300.name: Bejinx
boardgamepodcastepisode: MN 0056 John Ogilvie talks Bejinx and Skwozen

163301.name: Norman Church
163301.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of a Norman Church.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT), it also has a 360 view of the interior or the church.

“To arms! The Seljuk Turks come to defile our holy church!”

The bell tolls and signals it’s time for worship…or for war.

Norman Church is an internal view of a Norman Romanesque architecture Catholic Church with an external view of the surrounding graveyard.

Norman Church is intended for use in fantasy games or historical games set in the middle ages. It could also be used in modern games as a Norman church still standing in the present day.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Defense of Antioch: The Seljuk Turks are trying to push the Norman crusaders out of the Principality of Antioch. Casualties have been high, the many graves surrounding the church attest to that. The remaining Norman crusaders watch over the church from the bell tower. The Norman crusaders have spotted an army of Seljuk Turks coming to attack their church. Players can take the role of the Norman crusaders and priests defending the church or they can play as the Seljuk Turks trying to overcome their defenses and push them out of their land.

Historical background:

Norman culture began when Vikings were ceded the land of Normandy by France. These Vikings adapted by incorporating the local Romance languages and Romanesque architecture as well as converting to Christianity. Norman Churches were copied from original Frank designs.

Norman Church has several examples of Norman Romanesque architecture characterized by features like high arched doorways and a fortified tower for defense of the church.

Norman churches were most commonly found in the United Kingdom, eastern Ireland, northern France, southern Italy and Sicily, Malta, Cyprus, and the Principality of Antioch (This area is part of Turkey and Syria in the present) during the Crusades (The height of Norman influence was 1000-1100 A.D. The culture became Anglo-Norman after their conquest of England before finally becoming subsumed as part of the English culture as their culture mixed with their Anglo-Saxon subjects.) Churches in Italy often incorporated more Islamic, Lombard, and Byzantine architecture giving rise to a Sicilian Romanesque style of architecture. Most surviving Norman churches in modern times are in the United Kingdom.

163302.name: The Treasure of Skull Rock
163302.description:
From University Games: Do you have what it takes to find the treasure without waking up the haunted Skull? Travel along the treasure map in search of precious jewels - but watch out. Snatch them quickly before the Skull wakes up. Be quick and sneaky to make it around the island without losing the hard-earned booty.

The Treasure of Skull Rock:
Grab the treasure before the skull grabs you
Players race around the island collecting precious jewels from the haunted skull's treasure chest
Be the first to make it around the island and back to the ship with all your priceless loot

Contents include: haunted skull and treasure chest, 24 precious jewels, treasure map board, 4 playing pieces, die and instructions
For ages 8 years and up

163303.name: Florentiae noctes
163303.description:
User summary

Supplement produced by the Italian magazine Anonima Gidierre:
it is a monograph on the Italian peninsula and particularly Florence as a setting and source of lore for Vampire the Masquerade and Dark Ages.

163304.name: Gathering of Guardians
163304.description:
Players collect heroes to form the most renowned superhero team. Players attempt to collect the most fame by the time the major threat is defeated.

Set-up includes an auction to determine starting training players have (which is used to break ties and unlock player powers). Each turn is divided into two phases a recruit phase and an action phase. In the recruit phase a player may attempt recruit heroes to gain training and unique abilities, or they can refresh their allies to ally for more actions to be taken. In the action phase players have a variety of options including fighting villains, completing missions, or gathering resources.

Play continues until one play defeats the major threat (a randomly selected task that provides additional paths to victory). At the game end fame is awarded to players based on accumulated training, completed missions, progress toward defeating the major threat, and captured villains.

163305.description:
In Dystopian: the adventure deck game, one to four player assume the roles of Agents of the Dystopian Police Department (DPD) who are working to solve a murder.
They will work together, to search the city of Dystopia, among it's many different locations, first, looking for evidence to frame a suspect, then catching the criminal, before he escapes.

GAMEPLAY for a 1 player game: first thing, the player will choose 1 agent, each with a specific ability, and characteristic, then he'll choose a location, from where to begin his investigation.
Then, the player will form the investigation deck, which is composed of a mix of encounters (people and robots -called AI-Roids- that he will talk to, interrogate or "simply" attack that will help him with the investigation, or will hinder it), locations and clues.
There 12 locations, and each location can either be safe, neutral or dangerous. In safe locations, encounters will tend to be friendly, or harmless, while in dangerous locations, encounters will be aggressive and will be a liability to the player. Each encounter card shows three type of behaviors, and the player applies the one, associated to the location he was met.
To deal with an encounter, the player will use action points. If the player has no action points, he will suffer the consequences, which will involve, eventually, spending time, and the player only has a limited amount of time/days/turns, to catch the culprit.

The player will have to go through the investigation deck, gaining clues and evidence, to frame the suspect, that will make the player understand where the criminal is hiding.
It's up to the player to determine how fast or slow he should investigate, keeping track of his action points, knowing where he's investigating, and managing his time, action points and the risks.

Once the player has gained enough evidence (in the evidence phase) he will decide wether to keep investigating, to gain more evidence which will limit the number of locations the murderer will try to hide in, or start looking for the criminal, early on (but with more places to search him, into).

Dystopian: the adventure deck game is the second installment in the dystopian trilogy, with Dystopian: the manhunt, and the soon to be finalized: Dystopian: raise and fall.
163305.name: Dystopian: the investigation deck game

163306.description:
Travel from Aalborg to Copenhagen via Norway, Iceland, Scotland, Ireland, Wales, England, France, Spain, Italy, Greece, Austria, Belguim, Holland, Germany, Finland and Sweden.

The first to reach the goal in Copenhagen wins. But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). If you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards.

An exciting drive through all Europe. Family also for the little ones.
163306.name: Sjov Gennem Europa

163307.description:
Travel from Rødby Havn to Copenhagen via Denmark, Norway, Finland and Sweden.

The first to reach the goal in Copenhagen wins. But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). If you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards.

An exciting drive through all Scandinavia. Family also for the little ones.

163309.name: Against the Unknown
163309.description:
designer blurb

Hardboiled detectives. Wartime spies. Investigators of the uncanny.

Such are the intrepid heroes of AGAINST THE UNKNOWN!

Against the Unknown is a streamlined take on the GUMSHOE system, preserving its investigative core while speeding up character creation and play.

Features include:

- Quick character generation: background cards provide skill packages so that you can create the character you want and ensure a range of key abilities across the group.

- Unified abilities: all used diceless for investigative purposes, and added to die rolls for general tests.

- Intuitive tracking of physical and mental harm (Damage and Shock): players can voluntarily suffer harm to boost die rolls - will you put your body or sanity on the line to succeed?

- Usable with existing GUMSHOE materials.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
163310.description:
In Supermarché, you own a grocery store and your goal is to make money! Not only are you responsible for keeping the shelves stocked but also buying food at low prices to make a profit. Your customers are demanding, so you better have what they want. Will you sell everything before it spoils? Will you be successful? Or will your store go under?

Supermarché was designed for the 2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.
Winner: Best Overall Game
Winner: Best Medium-Sized Game
Winner: Best New Designer
2nd Place: Best Written Rules

Supermarché was nominated for the 2014 Golden Geek Award - Best Print & Play

Supermarché is free to print & play. The rules and components can be found in the files section below.

A Vassal mod, created by BGG user Fumanstu, can be found here.

163311.name: Super Programs 2
videogameversion: English/European ZX81 (Sinclair Research Instructions in Inlay re-release) edition
163311.description:
User Summary

Super Programs 2 (for 1K machines) was a compilation released for the ZX81. The programs were an eclectic mix of simple games and utilities:

1. Rings Around Saturn - Escape from Saturn, avoiding its rings and before you run out of fuel.

The game displays a flying saucer and two sets of "O"s, depicting an edge-on view of Saturn's rings. There are gaps in the rings and the aim of the game is to move your saucer through a large enough gap in the rings within a tight time limit.

2. Secret Code - How quickly can you work out the code which the computer has selected?

This is a simple computer version of Mastermind. The computer selects a 4 digit code, using numbers from 1-6. The player guesses the code and the computer responds with an X if a digit has been guessed correctly and is in the correct location, an O if a digit is correct, but in the wrong location, or blank if a guessed digit is completely incorrect. The user has 10 guesses to deduce the correct code.

3. Mindboggling - A solo or party game to create words from computer selected letters.

This is a computer implementation of Boggle, in which the player tries to create words from a 4x4 grid of randomly selected letters. Yet the user does not enter words into the computer - there is no computer checking of the answers. Indeed the instructions state that the user should select how long they want to play, and which rules to use. The computer just displays a grid of letters and a timer.

4. Silhouette - Generate your own computer assisted silhouette

The computer generates a random start point. By using the arrow keys (keys 5-8 on the ZX81) and keys 1-4 for diagonals, the user can draw a line on screen to create a doodle. This is exactly the same as "Doodle" on Super Programs 1, except that the background is black and the line is drawn in white.

5. Memory Test - Can you remember the extraordinary words produced by the ZX81?

The computer displays a "word" made up of random characters. After a short time, the "word" disappears and the user must enter it as they remember it. This is repeated 10 times.

6. Metric Conversion - Easy conversion between yards/feet/inches and metres/centimetres

A simple conversion utility.

163312.name: Kathmandu
163312.description:
The Object

To score the most points after three rounds by arranging the entire hand into melds.

Materials

52 card regular deck
22 tokens in two colors, 5 red and 17 blue
A way of keeping score

The Deck

A 52 card regular deck, ranked A-K-Q-J-10-9-8-7-6-5-4-3-2-A.

The Deal

The dealer shuffles the deck and one at a time deals out face down 10 cards to each player. The rest of the cards are placed face down in the center of the table forming the draw deck. Also each player takes 1 red token and places it in front of them.

Next place the remaining 3 red tokens adjacent to the draw deck and spaced about a card width apart from each other on the tableau. Then draw 2 cards from the draw deck placing them face up and adjacent to the red tokens.

The blue tokens are placed nearby so that both players can easily reach them.

Melds

Melds come in two flavors.

Group – Three or four cards with different suits and the same rank.
Sequence – Three or more cards of the same suit with ranks in sequential order.

The Play

The game is played in three rounds.

The non-dealer starts turns alternate.

A player on her turn must take one of the following actions.

1. Exchange a meld from your hand with a blue token, these cards are placed face down forming a discard pile or

2. Exchange an equal number of cards from your hand with red tokens from the tableau, these cards are placed face up to the tableau or

3. Take all of the red tokens from the tableau, replacing them with an equal number of cards from the draw deck, these cards are placed face up to the tableau or

4. Exchange any number of red tokens in your possession with an equal number of cards to the tableau or

5. Exchange any two cards from the tableau with two cards from your hand or

6. Take a red token from the tableau and replace it with a card from the draw deck, this card is placed face up to the tableau.

Players may have no more than 10 cards in their hands during play.

The game ends when either the draw deck is empty or all the blue tokens have been taken.

Scoring

Each blue token is worth 5 points each. Each red token is worth -2 points each and each card left in a player’s hand is worth -1 point each. Tally each player’s scores per round. Then tally each player’s final scores per round, the player with the highest score wins.

163313.name: Zoodiak - Il metagioco di ruolo
163313.description:
User summary

Supplement produced by the Italian magazine Anonima Gidierre: this product is an RPG rule set of its own.

Zoodiak is presented as a "meta-RPG": as such, it forces the players involved to dump their usual playstyle and take on the mindset assigned to each one depending on their zodiac sign, ascendant and planetary position: as such, Zoodiac cannot be played on its own but always needs to be played in association with another RPG.

What Zoodiac changes is a player's reactions and playstyle, not an adventure's plot nor an RPG's rule system.

163314.name: Florentiae noctes atto II - Dal dominio ghibellino allo splendore di Ginevra
163314.description:
User summary

Supplement produced by the Italian magazine Anonima Gidierre:
this monograph is intended as a sequel to the previous Anonima Gidierre presenta: Florentiae noctes, a product detailing the Italian peninsula and particularly Florence as a setting and source of lore for Vampire the Masquerade and Dark Ages.

163315.name: Starport Encounters
163315.description:
From the back cover:

It a happens to every referee at one time or another. The players jump in-system, dock at a starport, offload passengers and cargo, and then ask a string of questions.

'So, what other ships are in the port?'

'This cargo of pharmaceuticals - which does it actually contain?'

'I go to the bar for a few drinks. Who else is around right now?'

This book will allow you to answer those questions with the minimum of effort, giving every appearance to your players that you created your universe down to the very last detail. You come off looking like a World Class referee, while your players have the joy of experiencing a bustling universe where there are plenty of other poeple around who clearly have their own lives to lead, making it feel like a real, living, breathing place.

163316.name: OneDice Universal
163316.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Quick and easy role-playing rules for any genre

OneDice is a quick and flexible Role-Playing Game (RPG) system.

Whether you want to design worlds where you play mighty barbarians exploring a fantasy land, rebels on the run in outer space, superheroes fighting supervillains, or anything else, the OneDice system has been developed to be easily adaptable for your games.

Created by the UK Games Expo Award winning designers of Abney Park's Airship Pirates, Clockwork & Chivalry, and Renaissance.

Suitable for ages 10+

163317.name: Scrolls & Swords
163317.description: Scrolls & Swords is a re-skinned version of Lasers & Feelings adapting the game for the fantasy genre.

163318.name: The Vine Game
163318.description:
In The Vine Game you earn your fortune in the world of wine. You can make money producing wine in your own vineyard or operating a winery. You can also earn money trading in grapes, exporting grapes or by having the best combination of all those strategies.

At various times money, grapes or equipment can be in short supply so alliances and savvy trading between players will give you an advantage. At some point you might need to trash yor alliances to break out on your own and go for gold.

The Vine Game uses money as the means of exchange and has a nice retro feel which will give it a broader cross generational appeal. So your dad will love it too!

163319.description:
Information from designer:

The game system emphasizes command and control. Players command by Brigade and Regiment. To be successful, a player must plan for the eventual exhaustion of their troops, rotating them out of line to rest and recover stragglers. The result is an accurate modeling of the tempo of these battles.

Infantry combat is ranged rifle and MG fire, culminating in close assault. Artillery is powerful but ultimately limited. Shrapnel from the standard field guns is deadly against troops in the open, but only the rare howitzers firing high-angle HE can deal with trenches.

The map scale is 400 metres per hex. Tha map covers the entire southern section of the peninsula from the Sari Bair range to Cape Helles (i.e. from Anzac to Helles, including all the forts in between). Daylight turns are two hours, night turns are four hours.

Information from publisher's website:

On 25th April 1915, Winston Churchill, First Lord of the Admiralty, launched a hastily assembled force of British, Australian, New Zealand and French troops against the Turkish defenses on the Gallipoli peninsula. Their goal was to capture the forts that guarded the Dardanelles. With that achieved, the British and French Fleets would sail to Constantinople, topple the Ottoman government, and open up a supply line to Russia.

However, defending the beaches was an equal number of Turkish divisions, hardened in the recent Balkan Wars, led by well-trained Turkish officers, supported by advisors from the German General Staff.

An hour before dawn, in complete silence, the Anzacs rowed ashore at Ari Burnu, a place later to be famous as Anzac Cove. The Royal Navy had landed them in the wrong place! Huge dirt cliffs and scrub-choked washouts confronted them, rather than a beach and low dunes. Nevertheless inland they went, overrunning the Turkish pickets, only to become hopelessly confused by the night landing, jigsaw terrain, and inexperience.

Several miles inland, a gifted Turkish Officer, Mustafa Kemal, was reviewing his regiment after night maneuvers above Ari Burnu. Kemal's quick and furious counter-attack saved the day for the Ottomans, and set him on the path to become the founder of modern Turkey.

Further south, at Cape Helles, the Lancashire Fusiliers won six Victoria Crosses - before breakfast - as they ripped through the barbed wire on the beach. The invaders never reached even their first day's objectives, although the Turks only avoided defeat by a hair's breadth. With a different plan, they might have thrown the invaders back into the sea.

Gallipoli 1915: Churchill's Greatest Gamble realistically covers the first three days of the campaign, a time of wild maneuver, of decisive attacks parried by the timely arrival of reinforcements, and the onset of trench warfare. Speed - but not reckless haste - is the key to success.

The map covers the entire peninsula from north of Anzac Cove to Cape Helles, based on the 1922 British Ordnance Survey. Players can choose to land at the historical beaches, or create their own plans.

The game system emphasizes command and control. Players command by Brigade and Regiment. To be successful, a player must plan for the eventual exhaustion of their troops, rotating them out of line to rest and recover stragglers. The result is an accurate modeling of the tempo of these battles.

Infantry combat is ranged rifle and MG fire, culminating in close assault. Artillery is powerful but ultimately limited. Shrapnel from the standard field guns is deadly against troops in the open, but only the rare howitzers firing high-angle HE can deal with trenches.
163319.name: Gallipoli, 1915: Churchill's Greatest Gamble

163320.description:
(from the back and user's description)

Action Pack #10 features two new 8" x 22" maps (board 69 and 70) of largely open countryside with a small village, and 8 scenarios which use them.

Scenarios:


AP93 Best Think Again (Russians vs Germans, June 1941, Saudinikai, Russia)
AP94 Show Of Force (Germans vs Russians, March 1943, Graiworon, Ukraine)
AP95 Operation Kutuzov (Russians vs Germans, July 1943, Otrada, Russia)
AP96 Food Fight (Russian Partisans vs Ukrainian Partisans, April 1944, Hrabivka, Ukraine)
AP97 Strike Up The Band (Germans vs Americans, August 1944, Lesquern, France)
AP98 Last Laurels (Russians vs Germans, October 1944, Mihaly, Hungary)
AP99 Bare Foot Beating (Chinese vs Japanese, November 1944, Momauk, Burma)
AP100 Coal In Their Stockings (Americans vs Germans, December 1944, Foy-Notre-Dame, Belgium)


Action Pack #10 is not a complete product and assumes the buyer owns the core Advanced Squad Leader game system.
163320.name: ASL Action Pack #10
boardgameexpansion: For King and Country: ASL module 5a

163321.name: Treasure of the Snake
163321.description:
Treasure of the Snake harkens players to the exotic adventures of Indiana Jones or Romancing the Stone. Players compete or join together to capture the forbidden jewel.

Can you capture the jewel without awakening the snake? Players can either take turns or work as a group to capture the jewel on the snake’s basket. When the snake's eyes glow green players can safely move towards the basket, but when the snake’s eyes glow red everyone must FREEZE!! If the snake senses anyone moving, he will jump out of his basket and you must start over again.


Multiple ways to play, compete against your friends or join up as a team
Capture the jewel without waking up the snake
FREEZE when the snake's eyes turn from green to red

boardgamecompilation: The Resistance: Rogue Agent and Sergeant Modules
163322.description: The Resistance: Hidden Agenda & Hostile Intent is a combo box of two expansions for The Resistance. The box includes all modules from the Hidden Agenda expansion and the Hostile Intent expansion, plus two modules not included in any other expansions: Rogue Agent Module and Sergeant Module. This box is an exclusive Kickstarter edition.
163322.name: The Resistance: Hidden Agenda & Hostile Intent
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dragon’s Demize Episode 11 – Review of the Resistance
Episode 3: Expedition Northwest Passage, Robocop, BGGcon, and Skulls of the Shogun

163323.name: Airships: Conquer the Skies
163323.description:
A real-time strategy game where you design airships and then fight with them. The aim is to have pretty chaotic explodey fights and interesting ship design choices.

Ships are put together out of modules, and the layout of modules matters a great deal: everything on board is done by individual airsailors who need to run around, ferrying coal, ammunition, water and repair tools - and sometimes their fallen comrades.

Source: The Game Website.

163325.name: Seasons: Air Elemental Alternative Art Promo
163325.description:
Alternative artwork for the Air Elemental card. It was given out at Origins 2013.

Air Elemental
Cost: Three Air
Prestige Value: 12
Come-Into-Play Effect: All of the energy tokens present in the reserves of your opponents become air energy tokens.

163326.description:
Crystal Titan
Cost: 2-player: Fire, 3-player: Fire + 3 Crystals, 4-player: Fire + 8 Crystals
Prestige Value: 9
Activated Effect: Sacrifice Titan, throw away all cards in hand and sacrifice all crystals. Then sacrifice a card owned by someone else.
Ongoing Effect: Every time someone wants to sacrifice a card they have to give the owner of the Crystal Titan 3 crystals.

This card was given out at Origins 2013 to tournament winners.
163326.name: Seasons: Crystal Titan

163327.description:
Der Kampf um Cavern is a bonus legend for Legends of Andor. It is played on the mine side of the board. This legend is the last big adventure in Andor before the heroes are starting their journey to the north (Legends of Andor: Journey to the North).

The legend is playable with 2-4 players. With the expansion Legends of Andor: New Heroes it is possible to experience the adventure with up to 6 heroes!
163327.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Der Kampf um Cavern

163330.description:
Pet Shop is a Solitaire worker placement game that involves you as the new owner of a brand new pet store selling Dogs and Cats to special clientele! Your business must earn enough money and keep a high enough reputation by the end of 30 days or the pet shop will close. You have three main departments that are the money makers of the business: Grooming, Veterinarian, and Training. These three departments can be run by a contractor, a trained contractor “specialists” or a Professional. There are two other departments that take in new strays or donated pets and sell them once they’ve been through the three main departments: Sales floor and the Kennels. The last office is the Manager's Office, which is where you must be to hire new contractors or professionals, fire bad employees or send your contractor out for training to become specialist. The office is where you control the day-to-day operations of the business.

The game board shows a floor plan of the Pet Shop with all the departments and your office. Inside the three main departments is a space for an employee token and a pet card. In the office is a space for you and/or your Asst. Manage token. In the Kennels there is a space for employee tokens and four pet cards. The Sales floor has a space for employee tokens and four pet cards. There is another building next to the Pet Shop that has a Temp Agency and an Employee Training office. This building is used to hire new employees: contractors and Professionals. The Employee training office takes in your contractors and trains them to be a Specialist as a Veterinarian, Groomer, or Trainer yet they are not as proficient as the true Professionals. On the outside game border is a sidewalk with 30 spaces that represents a turn track to keep track of the 30 days you're in business. In the middle of the board is the Reputation track to keep track of your businesses reputation.

The game play is worker placement with a countdown 30 day turn tracker. You will collect new animals or abandoned strays into your kennels but are limited to three spaces within the kennel to hold the pets, so picking the right animal is critical. You the owner must decide which department is most important to change the new pet into money making breeds! Each animal has a large, medium or small breed and only certain departments can be used to help improve the animals for sales. You only start with a small non Professional staff although you the owner can run any department in the business. You must decide who to hire, place those new hires in the most needed departments, and decide when to place them in training to help each department improve their operations. With each animal you sell, you will earn more money to put back into the business to hire more employees, train more staff, to improve the pet quality for the customers.

The customers will have specific needs such as; breed size, quality and number of pets wanted.

Each day you will draw an event card which will show either a new customer walking into the store, a donated pet, a picked up stray, a business problem, or customer issues!

To win the game you must maintain a certain reputation and earn enough money to stay in business for another month, if you don’t do this you lose and your business goes OUT-OF-BUSINESS!
163330.name: Pet Shop

163331.name: The Jester
163331.description:
From publisher blurb:

This new arcane controller PC class for 4th edition is bound to teach you a few new tricks.

As a jester, many call you a fool. Those who do either know you well or not at all - and few know you well. To your companions, you are an enigma, performing stunts that only the foolish would attempt when they know, better than most, that your mind borders on genius. But genius or not, the subject of your mental acuity is forever off-limits. After all, people tend to speak more freely around a joker than an ace, and that is precisely as you like it. Jesters have a knack for jumping into any social circle, a part of none and hearing candid words from each. Information so gathered is the jester's most powerful tool, for the proper information spoken into the proper ear at the proper time can alter the course of history. Through his unique powers, a jester is able to slowly fulfill his charter to align the world to his henge, altering the planes in fate changing ways.

163332.name: The Marauder
163332.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring your Pathfinder RPG up to speed!

A reboot of the Mariner PC class from Cerulean Seas and the 4th D&D edition line "Clever Classes"; A mainstream PC class for the Pathfinder RPG, the Marauder, is the first in a long line of Clever Classes by Alluria Publishing.

Nothing is a swift and sure a marauder. Sacrificing armor for mobility and celerity, these unburdened warriors are able to move at incredible speeds, shift in any direction with alarming alacrity, and are capable of the most agile of maneuvers. In fact, the marauder seems more at home on the run with the wind at his back than a hunting wolf or swooping falcon. Driven by a desire to master their environment, and, perhaps, show off, marauders outrace everyone.

163333.name: Be Awesome At: Freelance Game Design
163333.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to break into freelance game design, but don’t know where to start? Have you already had a crack at pitching a project and failed? If so, this is the book for you! Inside, Creighton Broadhurst publisher at Raging Swan Press and an ENnie Award winning game designer reveals his hints, tips and strategies for a successful career in freelance game design.

This book covers such subjects as:

What's The Point of this Book?
Why You Should Take My Advice
Eight Reasons To Freelance
Twelve Reasons Not To Freelance
Golden Rules
Project Management
Great Books
Be Productive
Be More Productive
Project Outlining
How To Level Up
Why You Should Have A Website
How To Kill Your Career
Pitching a Project
Designing Dungeons
Designing Dungeon Ecology
Designing Unoccupied Rooms
Designing Encounters
Designing Treasure
Designing Settlements
Designing NPCs
Designing A Villain’s Motivation




What’s The Point Of This Book?

If you've always wanted to have a go at freelancing, but didn't know where to start, this book is for you! Within these pages, I've distilled my 14 years of experience in the gaming industry. I don't explain the esoteric, maddening mysteries of grammar, the hidden truths of sentence construction or the terrifying secrets of crafting a compelling story. I don’t talk about game design. You can get that all elsewhere. Instead I give you practical advice on how to work professionally, pitch to publishers and secure reoccurring work.

I've endeavoured to keep the advice herein as system neutral as possible. While my writing experience is exclusively with Dungeons & Dragons and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, the principles, tips and tactics within this book work with any game system.

Why You Should Take My Advice

In short, I've been around the block.

I've been on both sides of the designer/publisher fence. In 1999, I started out as a hungry, wildly inexperienced and tremendously naive freelancer. Now, I'm a grizzled (nay veteran) publisher and editor who has written, edited and developed well in excess of 1,000,000 words of gaming content. I've written for big and small publishers alike and won an ENnie for Madness at Gardmore Abbey (2012 [Silver], Best Adventure). A partial list of my design credits includes: Wizards of the Coast (Monster Manual V, Exemplars of Evil, Madness at Gardmore Abbey), Paizo Publishing (Dragon Magazine and Dungeon Magazine), Expeditious Retreat Press (Legacy of Darkness, Plague), Kobold Press (Deep Magic), Rite Pubishing (Pathways magazine, Adventure Quarterly) and Raging Swan Press (Retribution, Shadowed Keep on the Borderlands, The Sunken Pyramid).

During my early freelance days I was very lucky to have a mentor of sorts. Stephen Radney-MacFarland at the time was the RPGA's Big Cheese and my Living Greyhawk boss. During the course of the campaign, he gave me countless pointers and pieces of advice on how to commission, edit and develop modules. He gave me tremendous insights into the design process both in the campaign and at Wizards of the Coasts. (Luckily, he also didn't strangle me despite serious provocation on several occasion). During my time on the campaign I worked on over 100 modules and wrote another 20 or so myself. I had a lot of time to practise his suggestions.

In 2010, I founded Raging Swan Press and have built it into one of the most successful, prolific and recognised publishers of Pathfinder compatible products in the multiverse. I've worked closely with dozens of freelancers and to date (November 2013), have released over 160 supplements, adventures and player aids.

I want to share with you the insights and advice I've received over the years. I was lucky enough to have a mentor, but you might not.

163334.name: Hoard of the Dragon Queen (D&D Encounters)
163334.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to a special introductory edition of the Hoard of the Dragon Queen adventure, designed specifically for D&D Encounters (an official in-store play program) and the D&D Adventurers League (the official D&D organized play system).

This edition of the adventure is designed for 1st- through 3rd-level characters, and is divided up into three episodes of play. Characters who finish all three episodes should reach 3rd or 4th level at the end. Characters of 5th level and above cannot play in this D&D Encounters edition of the adventure, though they can pick up with episode 4 of the full adventure of Hoard of the Dragon Queen. Each episode should be played over multiple sessions of play. For D&D Encounters, the recommended session length is two hours. The full adventure contains additional play beyond this edition.

Playing this adventure in store as a part of D&D Encounters is fun and offers additional benefits to enhance the experience. Folios connecting characters to different factions in the world of the Forgotten Realms are provided for players, containing information and accessories, along with exclusive rewards. Dungeon Masters (DMs) receive a folio as well, themed to the storyline season (for this season, Tyranny of Dragons).

163335.name: GM's Miscellany: Dungeon Dressing
163335.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then GM’s Miscellany: Dungeon Dressing is for you! This gigantic compilations comprises all 34 instalments in the line as well as scores of riddles, new material and design essays by Creighton. GM’s Miscellany: Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, GM’s Miscellany: Dungeon Dressing is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

GM’s Miscellany: Dungeon Dressing presents the material originally appearing in:

Dungeon Dressing: Altars
Dungeon Dressing: Archways
Dungeon Dressing: Bridges
Dungeon Dressing: Captives
Dungeon Dressing: Ceilings
Dungeon Dressing: Chests
Dungeon Dressing: Corpses
Dungeon Dressing: Doom Paintings
Dungeon Dressing: Doors
Dungeon Dressing: Double Doors
Dungeon Dressing: Dungeon Entrances
Dungeon Dressing: Dungeon Names
Dungeon Dressing: Fiendish Traps I
Dungeon Dressing: Fiendish Traps II
Dungeon Dressing: Floors
Dungeon Dressing: Fountains
Dungeon Dressing: Gates & Portals
Dungeon Dressing: Goblin's Pockets
Dungeon Dressing: Legends
Dungeon Dressing: Legends II
Dungeon Dressing: Mundane Chest Contents
Dungeon Dressing: Pits
Dungeon Dressing: Pools
Dungeon Dressing: Portcullises
Dungeon Dressing: Sarcophagi
Dungeon Dressing: Secret Doors
Dungeon Dressing: Simple Magic Traps
Dungeon Dressing: Stairs
Dungeon Dressing: Statues
Dungeon Dressing: Tapestries
Dungeon Dressing: Thrones
Dungeon Dressing: Trapdoors
Dungeon Dressing: Walls
Dungeon Dressing: Wells
So What's The Riddle Like, Anyway?
So What's The Riddle Like, Anyway? II
So What’s The Riddle Like, Anyway? III
New Material: Three new fiendish traps as well as material focusing on concealed doors, strange growths, illumination, graffiti and loads of miscellaneous dungeon features; also includes nine dungeon design essays by Creighton.
All That Glimmer: Also includes as a free special bonus are treasures hoards 1-20 from All That Glimmers - after all, what’s a dungeon without treasure!

163336.name: So What's The Riddle Like, Anyway? III
163336.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your PCs are deep in the dungeon and have just encountered a terrifying monster which they have no chance of defeating. Luckily, the monster is bored and challenges the party to a riddling contest instead of simply just killing them. Alternatively, the party have encountered a sentient statue that will not let them past until they have answered three riddles correctly. At this point, a GM may panic and just hand wave the ensuing riddles or allow the PCs to answer them correctly by making skill checks.

So What’s The Riddle Like, Anyway? III picks up where So What's The Riddle Like, Anyway? II left off and presents sets of riddles grouped together dealing with a certain topic - for example the elements - for a GM to used in a themed dungeon or other adventure.

163337.name: Home Run SportACTION Baseball Card Game
boardgameversion: Home Run SportACTION Baseball Card Game
163337.description:
"It's a race to be the first to assemble your winning baseball team. Collect your Infield, Outfield, Pitcher, Catcher, Batter and score a Home Run. Scout for Recruits and Free Agents. Try not to strike out or hit a fly ball as you compete to pull together your team. Home Run Baseball SportACTION Card Game is the next best thing to being at the ballpark." -- From the Manufacturer.

Using a card drawing mechanic, players attempt to complete their "team,"by assembling one player card for each position (of the same color) and a Home Run card. Different cards represent the different positions -- Infield, Outfield, Pitcher, Batter and Catcher, as well as special cards which cause different game effects, and wild cards which can replace other player cards on your "team."

163338.name: Lauf rauf!
163338.description:
Everyone wants to get their three game pieces on the mountain as quickly as possible — but that is easier said than done as both the opponents and the grouchy mountain spirit want to hinder a player who's on the rise. Those who come too close to him will find a spell cast on them to slow their progress.

Whoever has the best tactics and the most luck with the dice in Lauf rauf! will win this family game!

163339.name: We Still Remain
163339.description:
With a modular map, expandable decks, and the ability to modify key features of the game to make it more or less difficult, We Still Remain caters and expands to meet the needs of all players, from those who are new to the game, to hardened wasteland veterans looking for an extra challenge.

The game features five core game modes that range from a 30-minute, action-packed capture the objective, to an atmospheric 100-plus-minute resource management scenario that highlights the game's role-playing factors, We Still Remain will fit into any part of your game night lineup.

Set in a post-apocalyptic world that has been overrun with the undead, We Still Remain is the story of survivors fighting to survive in a deserted landscape, scavenging loot and harvesting resources that they need to survive, while trying to avoid... the inevitable.

Players can loot, craft, and fortify, or find a weapon and take the fight to the undead. They can work cooperatively or against each other in scenarios that will test their luck, on an ever-changing map that spans three feet. The game is written as a series of diary entries, but the story is yours.

163340.name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – The Scourge
163340.description:
"Buboes, phlegm, blood and guts! Boils, bogeys, rot and pus! Blisters, fevers, weeping sores! From your wounds the fester pours."
–Plaguebearer Daemon war chant

Spread your corruption throughout the Traxis sector in The Scourge, the second War Pack in the Warlord cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest! The Scourge introduces a new warlord and a diseased style of play for Chaos with Ku’gath Plaguefather, a Daemon of Nurgle. In addition to Ku’gath and his Nurglings, you’ll find cards for each faction within this expansion, ranging from Space Wolves for the Space Marines, to Attack Squigs for the Orks, to powerful new battle tactics for the Tau.

This War Pack contains sixty cards, including one warlord with its signature squad and three copies each of seventeen unique cards, giving you a full play set of every unit, support, event, and attachment. Whether you torture your opponent with the Dark Eldar or strike from an Inquisitorial Fortress with the Astra Militarum, you’ll find the cards you need in The Scourge.

163341.name: L.A. Land Monopoly
163341.description:
User Summary

1 to 6 players can play Monopoly with this unlicensed Los Angles themed computer version of the classic game. Or create your own version by changing property names and chance cards.

163342.name: Cauldron of the Gods
163342.description:
Players take the role of a god in a friendly competition to reach the Glory goal set by the crowd, directing their champion in a wide array of arena-style games: Classics like King of the Hill, new modes like Shrine of the Wind, all played out via a simple rock-paper scissors mechanic with direct conflict resolved by a simple die roll without player elimination and the arenas sorted into easy-to-grasp zones.

The game features three different modes: Basic, designed for new or young players and quicker, simpler gameplay; Advanced, a more strategic mode where each player truly takes on the role of a God with resource management and asymmetric powers to twist the fates of their pawns in the arena; and Intermediate, which introduces the Advanced mode concepts and the active role of the player as one of the all-new pantheon of Gods in the Cauldron!

As part of the mission of Civilized Animal Productions to emphasize the role of games not just as a way to build relationships, relax, and have fun but also to teach the young, Cauldron of the Gods offers plenty of opportunity to discuss history and culture in the form of the Gods, emphasize sportsmanship by eliminating the other players as 'enemies' by using a system of proxy conflict and painting the game as a competition, and help curb cheating or disengagement by using a directly personal approach to conflicts between players and adopting a story-like, cinematic expression of the actual fighting. The game has frequent moments of tension between peaceable moments, which can be used to defuse negative behaviors and infuse positive approaches without interrupting the flow of the game. The Advanced and Intermediate modes of play are more complicated and this may be daunting to the younger range of players.

boardgameintegration: TKG ARENA: Rise of the Magi
TKG ARENA: Rise of the Magi
163343.description:
This game requires the following components from TKG ARENA: The Elemental Kings and is a standalone extension within the TKG ARENA family.

STANDARD DECK (DECK): 1

The Elemental Cycle

The concept of the elemental cycle is introduced into the game. This refers to the different relationships each element has with the others according to their dominance, opposition and weakness.

Fire (Ashw) dominates over Earth (Ohif), opposes Air (Ukelele) and is weak against Water (Esbner).

Water (Esbner) dominates over Fire (Ashw), opposes Earth (Ohif) and is weak against Air (Ukelele).

Air (Ukelele) dominates over Water (Esbner), opposes Fire (Ashw) and is weak against Earth (Ohif).

Earth (Ohif) dominates over Air (Ukelele), opposes Water (Esbner) and is weak against Fire (Ashw).

The objective of this game scenario is to be the first to discard all your cards in your CURRENT HAND. The recommended numbers playing the game will be 2, 3, 4 and 6 who will be distributed with 18, 12, 9 and 6 cards respectively from a shuffled STANDARD DECK.

Players start the game by each drawing a card from the top of a common shuffled DECK. The player with the highest number starts first and the players get their turns in a clockwise manner. The drawn cards go back to the bottom of the DECK. In the case of ties, the tied players draw again till the turns are resolved. The starting player may lay down any 1 card from his/her hand into a common pool in front of all players.

During each turn, each player may EITHER 1) play a card whose FACE VALUE is higher than the previous card; 2) play a card whose ELEMENT dominates the ELEMENT of the previous card; 3) pass and the turn goes to the next player.

Each time a player plays a card whose ELEMENT dominates the ELEMENT of the previous card, each player MUST choose a card from his/her CURRENT HAND and pass it to the player on the left.

In the situation when the game cannot go on as players can no longer put down cards due to the rules, the player with the least cards of the smallest number wins.
163343.name: TKG ARENA: General Disorder

163344.name: Shogyoumujou
163344.description:
A doujinshi (self-published) simulation of the Battle of Dannoura in 1185 (the sea battle that brought the Genpei War in Japan to a close), Shogyoumujou (諸行無常) is a Buddhist concept translated as “the impermanence of all things”. This is the main theme of the “Heike Monogatari”, a gunkimono (war tale) that gives a highly romanticized account of the war and the times that surrounded it. The book details the rise and fall of the Taira warrior house, the losing side at Dannoura. It drives home the point that “all that flourishes must fall” and that in a world of impermanence even the mighty are eventually reduced to “dust before the wind”. It’s a very fitting title, as the battle effectively ended the Taira's reign as a political and military powerhouse.

It has several sub-titles that change according to the game component-the full name is Shogyoumujou: Genpei Arasoi- Setouchi No Koubou-Genpei Saigo No Kassen-Dannoura No Tatakai (諸行無常: 源平の争い-瀬戸内の攻防-源平最後の合戦-壇ノ浦の戦い). This mouthful of a name translates as “Impermanence Of All Things: Genpei Strife-Offense And Defense Of The Seto Inland Sea-End of the Genpei War-Battle of Dannoura.

The game features the naval forces of the Taira and Minamoto warrior houses and their assorted allies. In a strange design decision, the historical situation is somewhat reversed-the Minamoto are severely outnumbered but have stronger units than their Taira foes (the Minamoto substantially outnumbered the Taira but the crews of the Taira ships were far more experienced at sea warfare as the clan first came to power by demonstrating their prowess at fighting pirates). Perhaps this was done to reflect the Minamoto’s lack of seaborne experience (the reduced numbers) but to show their large advantage in tactics (the increased strength)-their commander, Minamoto no Yoshitsune, purportedly ordered his archers to fire upon the rowers of the boats rather than the enemy soldiers (a violation of the unwritten rules of warfare of the day, something that Yoshitsune was notorious for throughout his career). While the game is relatively simple, it has lots of chrome rules that add historical flavor such as the effects of the changing tide on movement and combat, possession of the Imperial Regalia and the Child Emperor Antoku (both initially held by the Taira), defections, the role of leaders, and giving the Taira a couple of unique ship types. Historically, the Minamoto literally used the ‘turning of the tide’ to rout the Taira and were aided by key defections during the battle as well as Yoshitsune’s less than ‘honorable’ tactics. The Taira leader, Munemori, was fished out of the ocean (where he had been thrown by an ally disgusted at his reluctance to commit suicide to avoid capture and dishonor) and eventually executed. However, the Taira denied the Minamoto a complete victory when the matriarch of the clan and her attendants jumped into the ocean with the child Emperor and the Imperial Regalia. While the Minamoto managed to recover two of the three artifacts, the child Emperor died and the sword Kusanagi was lost forever. This was a major disappointment to the Minamoto’s alleged supporter, Retired Emperor Go-Shirakawa. The game’s victory conditions reflect all this, factoring both the Emperor/Regalia and enemy losses into the mix. It’s a fast (10 turns, a couple of hours) and fun play with a manageable amount of units and good balance.

163345.name: The AnalogXP (Issue 2 - Jul 2014)
163345.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue:

Indie v Mainstream: Authors and Publishers from many generations talk about it. What changed? How do the big publishers help?
Interviews
Marcelo Rodrigues - TAGMAR
Marcelo Cassaro - DRAGÃO BRASIL, TORMENTA
Antônio Sá Pop - REDBOX, OLD DRAGON
Thiago Edwardo - UNZA RPG, UED
Danilo Kobold - KOBOLD'S DEN, PULSE

Full Game: BRIGADE OF FOUR A four player story game about military teenagers dealing with their sexual and social urges while trying to survive as a team

163346.name: Refuelling Station
163346.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this first installment of the series is simple refuelling station, collecting fuel from the planet it is orbiting and distributing it to docked small craft and space ships.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) and an image showing the station.

163347.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 9 - Summer 2014)
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
rpgissuearticle: Rodworth Guide to Pre-Frontier Atomic Rockets
The Legend of Adha and the Brother Hunters
163347.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome Explorers!

Issue 9 is now available for download. This issue is all about spaceships. We have a couple of awesome deck plan by Joseph Meager that we rescued from a lost Star Frontiers site. Plus submissions from some regular contributiors and a cargo ship by a new author, M. Derryberry. In all, there are three sets of deck plans, a writeup on a fourth class of ships, some space stations, and a review of early atomic rockets.

We also have a new system brief and the continuing adventures of Jurak Hangna and Grymz, as well as a bit of Yazirian legend related by Alex Stone. We even found room to squeeze in some new equipment, more pages of the Titan Rising: 2299 comic, and some Knight Hawks encounters.

We are really excited about the image on the cover. The Assault Scout model used to make the cover was created by a talented Fronteirsman named Jay Thrurman. Look to see more done with this and other models he's created in future issues.

This issues contents are:

Adha and the Brother Hunters
Scree Fron
NGT-1000 Container Ship
Passenger Liner
Passage to Scree Fron
Freedom Class Ships
Titan Rising: 2299
In the Minzii Marketplace
Red Thunder
Rodworth Guide to Pre-Frontier Atomic Rockets
The Minotaur Sealion
Skylab Series Stations
Grimz Guide Comic #9




Grab your copy today and check out all the new material. And as always, keep exploring!

163348.name: The Monkeynomicon: Monsters of Karthun
163348.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the pages of the webcomic d20Monkey comes The Monkeynomicon: Monsters of Karthun, a full-color sourcebook written and illustrated by Brian Patterson. Featuring creatures from d20Monkey GM Sam Tigh's homebrew campaign setting of Karthun: Lands of Conflict, The Monkeynomicon features a selection of system-neutral creatures for use with nearly any system or campaign setting. Every creature is illustrated, features detailed backstories, and includes GM notes with suggestions on how to use each creature (written from Sam's perspective) to bring the world of Karthun and the creatures of The Monkeynomicon to life in your campaign.

163350.description:
Heroes and Mercenaries the return of the heroes is a fantasy-themed eurogame for 1-4 players getting all the feelings that fans of RPGs love with almost no random factor.

Each player gets into the skin of a farmer who must become a hero to the force, evil lurks around every corner, closer to their homes and farms.

Fight bravely, and may keep the skin and perhaps win gold and fame. But remember, not everything is black or white, and no one will look bad if you hire mercenaries to help in the dirtiest and / or difficult tasks.
163350.name: HYM, The return of the heroes

163351.name: Ruinous
163351.description:
Explore temples and swipe artifacts with your friends! You won't get very far alone, but who knows if your friends can be trusted?

In Ruinous, each player is an adventurer attempting to collect valuable items within dangerous ruins. They must brave these deadly ruins while balancing teamwork and trickery on the way to finding ancient Artifacts - powerful and expensive items that imbue their holders with unique abilities. But be careful: no item or player is safe from treachery! The first player to collect and sell at least $1000 worth of treasure and artifacts wins!

When it's your turn to explore a ruin you may first assemble an adventure party made up of other players in the game. The more people you recruit, the easier it is to overcome traps and obstacles. But keep in mind, they're still your enemies! Offer them a cut of the treasure to encourage cooperation, but remember: in the depths of the world's darkest ruins there are no contracts, there are no witnesses and sometimes only one survivor... So always prepare for an opportunistic backstabbing.

Should you enlist the help of your rivals or attempt to go it alone? Are your fellow adventurers trustworthy? Are you?

163353.name: Engines of Babylon
163353.description:
From the back of the book:

The Cold Stars Await Your Tread

Engines of Babylon gives you all the tools you need to add custom vehicles and low-tech system ships to your Stars Without Number campaign. From gravitic yard skiffs to main battle tanks, this all-new, previously unpublished SWN supplement, available in this bundle and nowhere else, lets you build system ships for campaigns set in the near future.

In Engines of Babylon you'll find a mighty trove of priceless treasures to reward the curiosity of reckless freebooters -- whether as trophies of a fabulous adventure, or as savage harbingers of a hostile power. A selection of maltech horrors should whet the appetite of any remorseless villain worthy of the name.

163354.description:
Faced with constant hacker attacks, the corporations created an artificial intelligence that could learn from the hackers themselves. The AI, codenamed Cypher, evolved faster than its creators could have imagined. It gained sentience, went rogue, and became the ultimate hacker. Now Cypher is fighting the corporations themselves for control of the nexus.

In Cypher, players take on the role of factions that are gathering characters from all spheres of influence — from corporate overseers to street level hackers — in order to dominate Cypher and seize control of the nexus. The player with the most influence at the end of the game wins!
163354.name: Cypher
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 3: Expedition Northwest Passage, Robocop, BGGcon, and Skulls of the Shogun
GenCon 2014 - AEG

163355.name: Cooperation
163355.description:
Subtitle: A Science Fiction Role-Playing System

Publisher's description:

Man's journey through the Third Millennium has not been an easy one. Wars, diseases and dictators have blunted man's progress and tried to quell his spirit. Yet, in the thirty-second century, man stands triumphant. He has formed an alliance with his interstellar neighbors for their common defense and economic well being. With man stands:


The insect-like businessman and manager, the Mantu;
The kangaroo shaped and telepathic D'Thal;
The methane breathing and master builder, the Wom;
The crystalline bodied and information devouring Crys; and
The hard shell, brave, and passionate Flots.


All standing united against the hulking menace of the Yadeze. It is a union of bodies, swords, and pocketbooks, a combination of incredible skills and awe inspiring talents. In short, it is a Cooperation of many different beings standing as one against the vastness of space.

163356.name: H1Z1: Just Survive
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Survival Game of the Year Nominee
163356.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




H1Z1 is a survival sandbox massively multiplayer online game [..].

The game is set during a zombie apocalypse in the rural United States, in which players will have to survive against the natural elements, hordes of zombies, and thousands of potentially hostile survivors through interaction, scavenging for resources, building shelters, and crafting.

Gameplay

The gameplay of H1Z1 emphasizes on multiplayer cooperation, trading, and team-building. In an interview with Adam Clegg from Sony Online Entertainment, he made clear that unlike other zombie massively multiplayer online games, the main focus will be about surviving against the zombies through teamwork with other players, rather than having a player versus player (PvP) environment with zombies as a backdrop. The ability to craft items has been implemented.

Source: Wikipedia, "H1Z1", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Addition
H1Z1 also includes a Battle Royale mode; a sort of Last Man Standing game mode where dozens of people are parachuted on an island. There are no zombies. Players gather weapons and resources. After a short time, the map will shrink, forcing the surviving players closer to each other. At the top of the screen is a counter constantly showing how many players are still alive on the map.

163357.name: Lords of the Fallen - Monk's Decipher
163357.description:
User Summary

The Monk’s Decipher will include a story add-on and will help unlock hidden secrets scattered throughout the worlds in the main game.

163358.description:
Forest Sprite is a cooperative game for 1-3 players in which players control a team of sprites and forest creatures on a mission to defend their home from an invading force of evil sorcerers and the monsters and misfortune they bring into your forest.

Forest Sprite can be played as a standalone board game (challenge mode) in which player(s) can choose pre-generated character(s) and play any 1 of the Chapters. HOWEVER
Sprite is best enjoyed by playing in campaign mode. In campaign mode, a player creates his or her own character and uses that character to attempt to beat each Chapter in order. Chapters get progressively more challenging, but as your character gains experience, it may attain new levels. When your character attains a new level, experience points can be spent to add new spells and abilities and upgrade stats. Characters will also pick up items as they progress through Chapters and defeat monsters.

Gameplay is pretty simple. The turn begins with the drawing of a mission and moving of any monsters that are on the board. The player may then take 3 actions using his or her character and/or forest animals in order to complete one of the open missions. When players fail missions, monsters get released. If 6 missions are failed, player loses. If the players draw all of the missions and fail less than 6 of them, they win (and gain experience points in campaign mode).

Forest Sprite is a game full of tense decisions. (starting with creating a good character!) There are no dice (the only luck is in the order in which missions are drawn). This is a game of planning, skillful gameplay, and coordination of resources.

2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest Awards;

Best Game
3rd Place

Best Art
2nd Place

Best Thematic Game
2nd Place

Best Large Game
2nd Place

Most Innovative Mechanic
2nd Place (tied)
163358.name: Forest Sprite

163359.description: For vegetarians, this expansion pack includes toppings stickers and order cards to replace the pepperoni from Top This! A Pizza Flicking Game. The order cards have a leaf icon located on the lower left corner to identify them from the originals.
boardgameaccessory: Top This! A Pizza Flicking Game
163359.name: Top This! Veg Substitution Pack

163362.name: Interregnum (Issue 4 - Jul 1994)
163362.description:
User Summary:

The theme of this issue is TECHNOLOGY.

163363.name: Dream City
163363.description:
Dream City is a multiplayer strategy game. Players will become residents and go through the different historical events of the Hong Kong community.

When facing the reconstruction and demolition of the community, players will decide how to develop the "ideal community." To become a winner, you have to ponder how to preserve valuable cultural environment, taking into account the affected stakeholders, including vulnerable groups who are often neglected in the mainstream economy.

Through the game, players can easily recognized community development, to explore issues of poverty, social development can rethink how the interests of justice. Game in conjunction with the school curriculum (Liberal Studies, Life and Social Studies), leadership training activities, life education topics, moral and civic education and career planning, etc., It is recommended to teachers, social workers, parents and other educators.

《你想社區Dream City》是一款多人策略版圖遊戲教材。玩家成為居民，經歷香港社區發生的大小事件，面對重建、清拆，玩家將決定如何發展「理想社區」。要成為真正的大贏家，你必須深思如何保留有價值的文化和事物，同時兼顧受影響的持分者，包括往往在主流經濟發展下備受忽略的弱勢社群。

透過遊戲，玩家可以足不出戶，輕輕鬆鬆認識社區發展，探討貧窮議題，重新思考社會發展如何能合乎公義。遊戲同時配合學校課程(通識科、生活與社會科)、領袖培訓活動、生命教育課題、德育及公民教育與生涯規劃等，是老師、社工、家長及其他教育工作者的好幫手。

163364.name: Monster Deck 55
163364.description: Monster Deck 55 is card deck system. It has 55 unique monsters on 18 different colored backgrounds. 3 different suits (airplanes, arrows and angles) 1-18 in each suit. Plus one joker. This deck can be used to play many different games.

163365.name: Boardcraft
163365.description:
Boardcraft is a modular board building and manipulation game. Set in an eclectic fantasy world, players build a board during the game, but can also change the board throughout the game. The board is consisted of 3x3 tiles with a random assortment of different terrains on them, including grass, water, marsh, boulder and lava.

Each player can also change the board in unique ways by swapping tiles, removing tiles or rotating tiles. This is most important because there are lava squares and players always need to be aware of how those tiles can change and move so they don't end up in lava and die.

There are also items to take including Weapons, Armor, Potions and Boardcrafting cards. On a turn, a player can make an attack, pick up an item, as well as play a "Genesis action" which means they can add a tile to the board.

The goal is to collect achievement points by completely missions and killing other players. Missions are randomly distributed and might be anything from collecting items, to performing in game actions such as pushing someone into water.

Players can play in teams or free-for-all in completely new environments each game.

163366.name: Run Dwarf Run!
163366.description:
Players take role of Dwarfs running away from dragon's lair, after stealing it's treasures.

The goal of the game is to give as much of the gold you carry to other players, so they will run slower. In the end, only one dwarf can escape the lair, others will be devoured or burned by the raging dragon.

The game uses a simple take that card mechanic, with cards that makes other player take some of your gold, give some of the gold of all players to one dwarf, or make the dwarf take some gold from the common pile.

163369.name: Futbol Mesa
163369.description:
Manage a football club and not let go until the last detail. Manage your players transfers, hire a coach, tactics, lineups, youth team, club stores, expand the stadium, shareholders, reservations, training, finance, sports betting...

THE GOAL OF THE GAME:
The goal is not to win the league, the goal is to be the player with the most manger points at the end of the game although naturally win titles helps to get points. Get points with reforms manager, hiring employees ...

TURN:

1- Round:
Renew the newspapper, calendar and the transfer market.
2 - Stage Management:
The first player place an employee in an area of ​​board and it goes the other players.
3 - Previous: Use training cubes and investments cubes to improve athletically and improve economically.
4 - Match: Roll the match dice and then play up to 3 players to execute personal movement to alter the result.
5 - End of the round: Rate the game, betting and renew your team's bench.

163370.description:
Carcassonne: Gold Rush is the second title in the "Carcassonne: Around the World" series of tile-laying games, with each game being based on the original Carcassonne design in which players slowly create a world by placing tiles on the playing area and scoring for various features in the landscape they create.

In Carcassonne: Gold Rush, players return to the 19th century in the United States when cowboys drove cattle, trappers traded with Native Americans, the first railway routes appeared, and explorers — that is, the players — sent their henchmen to gold mines to laboriously search for gold nuggets. Depending on where you place your tent, you might be able to snatch a nugget from another explorer — but sometimes you'll be left holding fool's gold while someone else uncovers a rich gold find...
163370.name: Carcassonne: Gold Rush
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2014 - Hans im Glück

163371.name: Level 7 [Omega Protocol]: Passage Promo
163371.description:
The "Passage" promo card has the following text:

Room
Passage:
Place an enemy passage tile on the edge of any tile in this room. When building room stacks during setup, replace any card that spawns enemies in a room stack with this card. Set the replaced card aside.
Priority 2

163372.name: Thought Lords of Mars
163372.description:
publisher blurb

It's time for pulp sci-fi adventure on the Red Planet! Join Nick Timber, Clare Tremont, Sam Castle, and Dr. Lem as they tangle with Martian air pirates, energy-sucking sky squid, and the nefarious plots of the Thought Lords!

163374.description:
This is a set of three promo Item Bag cards for Zombie 15'.

They are:

Battering Ram
Incendiary Ammunition
Laser Sight
163374.name: Zombie 15': Promo Cards

163375.name: Domains at War: Free Starter Edition
163375.description:
From page 6 of the supplement:

Tomorrow you will bring the battle to the foe. Tonight you walk among the troops you’ll lead. The mercenaries are veterans and sleep while they can, but the anxious peasants levied from your lands seek comfort in recounting your victories. You sit at their campfire, wearing your ring of invisibility so that you can listen instead of command. Remember when you were like them? Back when you first entered the dungeon, you wielded a sword and fought for gold, glory, and the favor of the gods. Winning these earned you a throne. Now you wield an army, and fight for the right to rule the domains at war.

Domains at War (D@W) is a supplement for the Adventure Conqueror King System™ (ACKS) as well as two wargames in its own right - one for strategic campaigns, another for tactical battles. This Free Starter Edition focuses on the basics your fantasy RPG characters need to raise armies, conquer domains, and fight pitched battles. It also serves as an introduction to the Complete Domains at War Set which includes D@W: Campaigns and D@W: Battles, plus maps and counters for playing conflicts in more detail. The Complete Set is available separately from Autarch, but you don’t need it to enjoy the following rules. References to D@W: Campaigns and D@W: Battles are provided to help those who are using the Starter Edition to learn the Complete rules.

163376.name: Zombie 15': Bonus Campaign
163376.description:
A bonus campaign for Zombie 15', with 5 new Scenarios following the events of the base game campaign.
It was offered in printed form to Kickstarter backers, and a PDF version is available on IELLO's website.

163377.description:
Rolling Japan is a light "multiplayer solitaire" dice game. Each player has a map of Japan that's divided into the 47 prefectures, which are then bunched together into six differently colored areas.

On a turn, a player draws two regular six-sided dice from a bag and rolls them; the bag starts with seven dice, six matching the colors of the areas on the map along with a wild purple die. All players now write down each number rolled on any prefecture of the matching color, i.e., if the blue die shows 4 and the yellow a 2, write a 4 in one blue prefecture and a 2 in one yellow prefecture. If the purple die is rolled, you can place this number in a prefecture of your choice; additionally, three times per game you can choose to use a non-purple die as any color. However, neighboring prefectures — including those in different areas connected by blue lines — can't have numbers with a difference larger than 1; if you can't place a number without breaking this rule, then you must place an X in a prefecture of the appropriate color. (If all the prefectures in an area are filled, you can ignore the die or use one of your three color changes to place the number elsewhere.)

After six dice have been rolled, mark one round as being complete, then return the dice to the bag and start the next round. After eight rounds the game ends, and whoever has the fewest Xs on her map wins.
163377.name: Rolling Japan
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ68: Rolling Japan (2014) Hisashi Hayashi
Episode 1 - Conventions
Essen 2014 - Japon Brand

163378.description: Zombie 15': Left Alone – Solo Campaign consists of fifteen Zombie 15' scenarios for a single player, with the scenarios being linked and growing progressively more difficult. Each one focuses on a single character, highlighting their special ability, and the scenarios tell the early post-zombie stories of these characters.
163378.name: Zombie 15': Left Alone – Solo Campaign

163379.description:
This is a set of 12 extra Search Cards for Zombie 15'.

The cards were first made available to Kickstarter backers of Zombie 15'.
163379.name: Zombie 15': 12 Extra Search Cards Promo

163380.name: CHRONOS Universal LARP System Core Rule Book
163380.description:
From publisher blurb:

The system that every theater LARPer has been waiting for.

The CHRONOS Player Book is the guide for using the CHRONOS cards to make a character, handle conflict resolution, determine success and failure; as well as how to apply the CHRONOS Universal LARP system across a multitude of worlds. The CHRONOS book also explains the game concepts and terminology, such as Aether, Fonts, Thresholds, Skeins, Resolution Hand, and the Character Deck in relation to playing a CHRONOS game.

The CHRONOS Core Book illustrates how the game system as a whole works, while the individual cards put the mechanics for their character in the players own hands. The CHRONOS Core Book serves as the underlying mechanics document for all CHRONOS games, allowing future CHRONOS Skeins to focus on genre instead of rewriting mechanics for every new game world.

With conflict resolution taking only seconds instead of hours, the ability to transition seamlessly between narrative table top play and theater LARP play, the versatility to run nearly any game world, plus the support of additional theme and world ‘Skein’ decks, the CHRONOS system is what gamers have been waiting for.

163381.name: CHRONOS Universal LARP System Core Deck
163381.description:
From publisher blurb:

The system that every theater LARPer has been waiting for.

The CHRONOS Core Deck is the driving force behind the amazing CHRONOS Universal LARP System. A card based system which resolves conflicts in near real time, the CHRONOS system allows Game Organizers the ability to organize any LARP they can dream of.

The CHRONOS Core Deck provides the base character deck, and is the perfect starting point for any potential player or Game Organizer. Instead of producing character sheets, players will choose cards and spend experience points to add cards to their deck. All conflict resolution happens by choosing the best three cards to use, and then performing the action in slow motion timed combat.

Perfect for conventions, pick up LARPs, or even running table top games which can transition back and forth between live play and table top narration, the Chronos Core Deck is the first step towards changing gaming forever.

Deck Contains:

Each card has the game mechanics on the card, so no more looking up powers in a book mid-game
Each card has color and design coding to make selection simple
108 Core Cards
12 Core Character Cards
24 Profession Cards
22 Equipment Cards
30 Specialty Cards
20 Base Aether Cards

163382.name: CHRONOS Universal LARP System Aether Support Deck
163382.description:
From publisher blurb:

The system that every theater LARPer has been waiting for.

The CHRONOS Aether Deck is a useful addition to the Core cards for CHRONOS Universal LARP System. In CHRONOS, Aether is what powers the universe. The elemental forces of Earth, Air, Fire, and Water are at the player's fingertips as a key part of their Character deck.

The CHRONOS Aether Deck provides the base set of Aethers from the Core Deck, with the addition of five more powerful Aethers. The Aether Deck also includes Font and Threshold cards. Mystic pinholes and gateways into worlds beyond, Fonts and Thresholds are useful tools for a Game Organizer wanting to change things up. The Aether Deck is also particularly useful for Game Organizers planning to run larger games.

With more bang to the buck, the Aether deck is ideal for the Game Organizer running at conventions or large LARPs, or even the player who wants a little more oomph for their character. The power can be yours.

Deck Contains:

Each card has the game mechanics on the card, so no more looking up powers in a book mid-game
Each card has color and design coding to make selection simple
80 Base Aether Cards
10 Font Cards
10 Threshold Cards

163383.name: Patchistory: Promo Tiles
163383.description:
Patchistory: North American Tiles is a set of six tiles offered at conventions and as a preorder bonus for the 2014 English edition of Patchistory. The historical figures on the tiles are:


Montezuma
Pacal
Sacagawea
Benjamin Franklin
Harriet Tubman
Richard Nixon

163385.name: The Loremaster
163385.description:
From publisher blurb:

The loremaster is a gatherer and keeper of secrets. He is often obsessed by the written word, with cryptic and arcane lore serving as his devoted mistress. Holding to the adage that knowledge is power, the loremaster often forsakes material wealth and personal glory for rare or unusual information, an endless quest that brings him ever closer to his unattainable goal: perfection through edification.
